We believe that our clients and patients deserve the best possible care we can provide and are consistently working to improve our standard of care, clinic culture, and our reputation within the community. Swing shifts with the potential for periodic night shifts depending on staff training needs. This person will serveas atraining and education resource for hospital team members as well as helping with cases in the treatment room.Responsible for providing training to enhance day\\-to\\-day hospital operations as well as actively contributing to the professional growth and development of individual team members.

**WHAT YOU'LL DO (Essential Functions**):

* Help foster a culture built on our values: Respect, Learning, Do the Right Thing, WOW Service, Communication,and Fun.
* Provide active training, coaching, education, and mentorship with the hospital team including leadership.
* Serve as a positive role model, emulating our core values while encouraging hospital leadership and individual team members to do the same.
* Provide customized training based on needs of the hospitalas well as share Best Practices.
* Assist in the development and implementation of training for new programs, platforms, and projects as needed.
* Work with medical director to helpensure hospital teamprovides quality medical care for pets.
* Provide training and support to help ensure the hospital is delivering "wow" client service.
* Assist the hospital in providing relevant client education material and resources.
* Maintain database of continuing education opportunities for all team members.
* Treat clients, patients, visitors, team members, colleagues, and vendors in a professional, courteous manner.
* Perform other duties and projects as assigned.

**About You:**

* Willingness to***guide, mentor, and support***fellow team members!
* Credentialed veterinary technician with***strong technical skills***(to include placing IV catheters, venipuncture, administering premedication, anesthesia induction \\& monitoring,surgical nursing, and perioperative nursing care, radiographs, etc.).
* You are committed to outstanding client service, exceptional patient care and really***want to make a difference***!
* You can***easily adapt to the different needs of each patient***and are able to remain composed during stressful and emotional situations.

**Compensation:**

* Competitive Compensation \\- $30 36/hour (commensurate with experience).
* Overnight and weekend shift differential.

**Benefits (available after 90 days of employment):**

* Potential for Sign\\-On Bonus
* CE Allowance Available
* Uniform Allowance
* Paid License Renewal Fees
* Paid Time Off
* Generous Employee Pet Discount
* Tuition Reimbursement/Assistance Available
* 401k \\+ Employer Matching
* Medical/Dental/Vision
* Voluntary Life and AD\\&DInsurance, long\\-term care, Accident, Critical Illness, and Hospital Indemnity
* HSA/FSA

**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR (Essential Qualifications):**


Education:

* Associate's degree in veterinary technology required.
* Bachelor degree preferred, but not required.


Professional Licenses/Certifications:

* State\\-recognized veterinary technician certification (LVT/CVT/RVT) with a credential in good standing required.
* Veterinary Technician Specialist (VTS) preferred, but not required.


Knowledge, Skills, and Ability:

* Knowledge of veterinary hospital practices and procedures.
* Ability to supervise, motivate, and coach team members.
* Knowledge of medical equipment.
* Proficiency with a variety of computer programs including Cornerstone, Microsoft Outlook, Word, Excel, and SmartFlow preferred.
* Demonstrated ability to leverage interpersonal skills and technical knowledge to bring people and ideas together to perform effectively.
* Excellent written, verbal, and listening communication skills with a client\\-oriented approach.
* Strong analytical, critical thinking, judgment, and problem\\-solving skills.
* Ability to collaborate through leadership, including to provide high\\-quality medical care.
* Ability to interact with a variety of clients and employees in a professional, compassionate, and respectful manner.
* Ability to develop effective working relationships to gain trust and establish credibility with clients and staff.
* Strong organizational and time management skills including managing multiple priorities.
* Strong professional level of confidentiality in handling information using ethical discretion.
* Ability to proactively identify issues and formulate solutions.

**WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**

While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk and hear. The team member must frequently use a computer for long periods of time.Specific vision abilities are required to do this job including close vision. This position requires walking, standing, and sitting for long periods of time.The work environment may include working with aggressive animals that bite and/or scratch. May require flexible work hours including nights and weekends.Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted.

description:

Cat and Dog Hospital of Portland is seeking a Certified Veterinary Technician to support our three \\-Doctor practice. Our FT techs work 4 ten\\-hour days. We are open 8\\-6 Monday\\-Saturday.


Cat and Dog Hospital of Portland is a compassionate Fear Free/Cat Friendly hospital with state\\-of\\-the\\-art equipment and a bright and modern facility. Our doctors and staff are committed to high quality medicine and gentle, low\\-stress handling techniques. Our staff is small and depends highly on hard work, communication and reliability. title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**CUSTOMER SERVICE REPRESENTATIVE (CSR)**


Token Creek Veterinary Clinic, located just outside Sun Prairie, WI has an immediate opening for a full time or part time Client Service Representative (CSR). We are a 5 doctor American Animal Hospital (AAHA) accredited practice (the only one in the Sun Prairie/Deforest area) that is dedicated to providing quality service and care for our customers and their dogs and cats. Our clients and their pets love us as we consistently get 5 Star ratings, and we were voted the Best of Sun Prairie!**POSITION SUMMARY:** The Customer Service Representative (CSR) actively recruits new clients and promotes hospital services. Schedules client visits and drives the flow of clients and pets through the hospital to aid the productivity of the veterinary medical team. Ensures good communication with the clients, and coordinates the care of the pets, influencing clients to return and refer their friends and families.**WHAT YOU'LL DO** (Essential Functions):

* Foster a culture built on our values: *Respect, Learning, Do the Right Thing, WOW Service, and Fun*
* Maintain knowledge of the services the hospital provides and utilizes the information to promote the hospital's services and products to existing and prospective customers
* Welcome clients and pets, ensuring that they are comfortable in the hospital, and educating the clients about preventative care and pet health needs
* Assist incoming clients. Document and enter the pet's history, requested services, and other pertinent information within the practice management software
* Direct the flow of clients and pets to ensure superior client care and maximum productivity of the veterinary medical team
* Answer basic questions from clients on the phone and in person, act as an initial triage to determine patient's service needs. Refer the patient to the appropriate veterinary staff as needed
* Schedule client appointments and follow\\-up exams. Work with Veterinarian(s) and veterinary staff as needed to ensure optimal scheduling
* Assist outgoing clients by providing all necessary instructions, information, and invoices
* Dispense prescription items per the Veterinarian's instructions and sells retail products
* Responsible for cash management including accepting payments for products and services provided. Perform daily reconciliation of the cash drawer
* Respond to customer complaints in a professional, courteous manner and act satisfactorily to resolve the problem
* Support a practice environment that promotes collaboration and teamwork to ensure the delivery of quality, compassionate, effective, and efficient health care to pets
* Comply with all practice policies, quality assurance guidelines, and minimum standards of care
* Perform other duties and projects as requested

**WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR** (Essential Qualifications):


Education:

* High School Diploma or GED required Professional Licenses/Certifications: None


Experience:

* 1\\+ years experience in retail sales or customer service preferred
* Experience in a medical facility desired


Knowledge, Skills and Ability:

* Ability to provide effective customer service principles
* Basic knowledge of medical terminology
* Basic proficiency with a variety of computer programs including Microsoft Office Suite
* Basic written, verbal, and active listening communication skills
* Strong customer relations and interpersonal skills
* Exercises tact and diplomacy in dealing with sensitive issues and situations
* Prioritize work and handle a variety of tasks simultaneously, with frequent interruptions
* Strong organizational and time management skills
* Effectively and quickly responds to requests in a proactive manner
* Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy

**PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**  

While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk and hear. The team member must frequently use a computer for long periods of time. Specific vision abilities are required to do this job including close vision. This position requires walking and/or standing for long periods of time, bending, reaching, grasping, and repetitive motions. May be exposed to disinfectant/sanitation chemicals, pets dander, and excretions. This position is exposed to low to moderate noise levels. Must be able to lift up to 30 lbs. unassisted, 50 lbs. with assistance. Must be able to work flexible hours including evenings and weekends.

**SUPERVISORY RESPONSIBILITIES:**


This position does not carry any supervisory responsibilities butmay evolve into a leadership position for the right candidate!

**JobType**: Full\\-time or Part\\-time

**Schedule**:

* Monday through Friday
* No weekends
* Flexible scheduling

**Benefits:**

* Paid time off
* Paid holidays
* Health, dental, vision, life insurance
* 401k with match
* Team member discounts
* Learning and CE programs/assistance
* Uniform allowance
* Bonus pay
* Penn Foster tuition assistance and more!

***Pay range starting at $16/hr. and up depending on experience.***

**Hours/Schedule: 32\\-40 per week. We are open Monday through Friday; 8a\\-6p. Flexible schedule.**

title: Veterinary Technician Supervisor - ER/ICU
description:
**Position Title:** Support Staff Supervisor (ER/ICU)
  
  

**Our Culture:**  

Bridgetown Veterinary Emergency and Referral (BVER) is a specialty animal hospital located in Portland Oregon. We are looking for a qualified ER/ICU Managerto join our hospital and support our specialty technicians and assistants. We offer specialty and emergency veterinary services and have veterinarians in Surgery, Internal Medicine, Neurology, Emergency and Critical Care. We are a culture and medicine focused family who believe in doing the right thing for our employees and the veterinary community.
  
  

The Bridgetown Veterinary Support Staff Supervisor is a team\\-focused, passionate, and highly dependable mentor and leader that plays a vital role in daily workflows. As a supervisor, you will enable conversation, communication, and coordination among hospital team members as well as pet families. The supervisor leverages strong communication, collaboration, and planning skills to ensure the team is supported. You will support the team by directing appointments, managing the schedule, and maintaining team engagement and a positive supportive work environment.
  
  

**Job Type:** Full Time
  
  

**Salary:** $80\\-85K
  
  

**Benefits:**  

401(k) with employer match
  
  

Dental/Medical/Vision Insurance with opportunity for HSA/FSA
  
  

Employee Assistance Program
  
  

PTO
  
  

And More!
  
  

**Work Location:** In person
  
  

**Attributes:**  

Ability to express oneself clearly both verbally and in writing to enable respectful and successful lines of communication among team members.
  
  

Strong organizational skills to help plan, prioritize, and collaborate effectively.
  
  

Strong interpersonal skills, including active listening, dependability, patience, and flexibility.
  
  

Comfort discussing and navigating difficult conversations while maintaining calmness and kindness.
  
  

Maintain team member and company confidentiality where needed and when appropriate.
  
  

Commitment to following up and following through with action items generated from meetings, daily tasks, team needs, and/or client interactions.
  
  

Adaptable, resourceful, and forward thinking
  
  

Motivation and curiosity to develop as a team advocate and team member.
  
  

Knowledge of veterinary workflows and procedures
  
  

**Role Responsibilities:**  

Communication and Collaboration
  
  

Create staff schedules, ensuring that teams have appropriate coverage.
  
  

Maintain professionalism and treat all team members throughout the organization, as well as pet families, with respect and kindness.
  
  

Display agility in communication styles between team members, pet families and referring community to disseminate information and knowledge, closing the loop appropriately and professionally.
  
  

Responsible for troubleshooting shift gaps and team member coverage
  
  

Create open, supportive, and effective relationships and environment with all team members by resolving any team conflict in the moment or no later than end of team's shift to prevent discord while escalating concerns as needed.
  
  

Maintain weekly contact with your manager to ensure open communication and escalation of any support recommendations or additional needs recommended by self or other team members, so requests can be addressed promptly.
  
  

**Administrative:**  

Utilize WhenIWork to create and publish schedule no later than 60 days ahead of time.
  
  

Maintain appropriate documentation of team member disciplinary plans such as PIPs and coaching conversations.
  
  

Work with the Nursing Director and Hospital Administratorto enforce performance improvement plans.
  
  

Maintain and document client records and communication in accordance with organizational, state, and federal guidelines.
  
  

**Requirements:**  

A minimum of 3 years' ER/ICU veterinary experience with a focus on team dynamics and day to day workflows
  
  

A licensed veterinary technician is preferred.
  
  

Able to lift up to 25lbs without assistance.
  
  

**Reports to:** Nursing Director

title: Customer Service Representative
description:
**Job Title: Customer Service Representative**  

**Location:** Gig Harbor, Washington 98335  

**Salary:** $18\\-24/hr


Are you the kind of person who can handle a *chaotic phone line*, *calmly assist a panicked pet owner*, and still find time to give a high\\-five to your teammate? If so, we want you to join the Puget Sound Veterinary Specialty \\& Emergency team as a customer service representative! We’re looking for someone who can juggle a variety of tasks, deliver exceptional service, and keep their cool in the fast\\-paced, high\\-energy world of veterinary medicine.


We’re not just any animal hospital—we are a compassionate, innovative, and customer\\-centricorganization dedicated to providing high\\-quality emergency care for pets and the peace of mind their owners desperately need. And we need a customer service representative who will be the calming voice on the other end of the line and the friendly face when clients walk through our doors. So, if you’ve got a knack for customer service, an understanding of the veterinary world, and a passion for making people (and pets) feel at ease, you’re the one we’re looking for!

**What You’ll Be Doing:**  

As our customer service representative, you’ll be at the heart of everything we do. You’ll handle a *high volume* of calls, manage appointments, check in clients, and make sure everything runs smoothly. Whether it’s reassuring a stressed\\-out pet owner or providing accurate information to our veterinary team, you’ll need to juggle multiple tasks and keep everyone on track. You’ll need to be quick on your feet, especially in high\\-stress situations when the phone is ringing, and emotions are running high. Don’t worry though—we’re a team\\-oriented bunch, and we’ve got your back!

**What We’re Looking For:**  

You should have at least 1 year of experience in a veterinary hospital (bonus points for knowing your way around veterinary medical terminology). A strong communicator who can listen actively, empathize with pet owners, and clearly explain complex information—that’s what we’re after! You’ll need to be comfortable handling sensitive situations with care, while remaining calm, professional, and friendly. You’ll be juggling appointments, managing inquiries, and helping our veterinary team stay organized, all while keeping that warm, welcoming demeanor.


You should also be able to handle multiple tasks at once—after all, we’re a busy hospital, and our customer service representatives are the first line of defense in managing everything that comes through the door or over the phone. Your ability to stay organized, prioritize tasks, and think on your feet will be crucial. Plus, a basic understanding of veterinary care and procedures is a must, so you can provide clients with the best, most accurate information possible.

**Why You’ll Love It Here:**

* Competitive pay ($18\\-$24/hr)
* Health, Dental, and Vision Insurance
* Employee Assistance Programs
* Employee Pet Discount (because your pet deserves the best, too!)
* WorldVets Travel Opportunities (yes, you can travel and help animals in need worldwide!)


If you’re ready to be part of an awesome, team\\-oriented crew and make a real difference in the lives of pets and their owners, then don’t wait—**apply now**! Trust us, this job is *pawsitively* amazing, and we can’t wait to meet you!

**Join our team and let’s make a difference together, one paw at a time!**

title: Veterinary Assistant
description:
**VETERINARY ASSISTANT**


Mt. Scott Animal Clinic in Portland, OR needs 1\\-2 more Veterinary Assistants to keep up with a growing client base! Our veterinary assistantsenjoy a rewarding career centered on a passion for quality veterinary care and client education. We provide training opportunities and a fun, compassionate, inclusive work environment. Our entire team is an integral part of providing high\\-quality Fear Free medicine and service. Our Core Values maintain our focus on why we enjoy veterinary medicine \\- caring for pets and their people without sacrificing teamwork and compassion for one another.

**POSITION SUMMARY:**


The Veterinary Assistant supports and assists the Veterinarians and Veterinary Technicians, ensuring the safety of pets and clients, and the continuity of quality veterinary care. They work to keep pets safe and comfortable during their visit. The duties and responsibilities described are not a comprehensive list and may vary depending on the needs of the clinic. **You must be experienced with assisting in surgery, or willing and able to learn quickly. You must be able to work Saturday shifts.**


See mtscottanimalclinic.com for more information about our wonderful clinic!

**WHAT YOU'LL DO(Responsibilities included but not limited to:)**

* Foster a culture built on our values: Respect, Learning, Do the Right Thing, WOW Service, and Fun
* Provide professional, efficient, quality medical care and exceptional service to clients while maintaining maximum productivity
* Clean, disinfect, and prepare exam rooms, medical equipment, and surgery between each appointment
* Obtain initial patient information, medical histories, vaccination records, and the reason for the pet's visit. Document patient information, and update records
* Calm, soothe, comfort, and restrain pets before, during, and after procedures
* Take note on examination results and updates records as directed by veterinarians
* Provide the owners education, resources and information on how best to care for pets in general, at the Veterinarian's direction, for specific conditions, and after various procedures
* Monitor and track pet's physical status and vital signs following surgery
* Monitor, record, and report the physical condition and vital signs of the hospitalized pets
* Clean and disinfect cages, pens, runs, and boarding areas
* Feed, water, bathe, and exercise pets during their visit
* Respond to general questions from clients
* Perform and set up procedures that do not require Veterinarian or Veterinary Technician assistance
* Examine pets, performing basic health checks, looking for signs of disease, illness, or injury, and treat them under the direction of the Veterinarian
* May administer medication, perform routine laboratory tests, fill prescriptions, and educate client on use and side effects of medication under the direction of a Veterinarian or Veterinary Technician
* Provide professional, efficient, quality care and exceptional service to clients while maintaining maximum productivity
* Support a practice environment that promotes collaboration and teamwork and ensures the delivery of quality, compassionate, effective, and efficient health care to pets
* Comply with all practice policies, quality assurance guidelines, and minimum standards of care
* Perform other duties as requested

 **WHAT WE'RE LOOKING FOR (ESSENTIAL QUALIFATIONS):**

* High School Diploma or GED required
* Minimum 2 year experience as a veterinary assistant
* Experience assisting in surgery


Skills, Ability and Knowledge:

* Broad knowledge of animal science
* Basic knowledge of pharmacology
* Proficiency with a variety of computer programs including Microsoft Outlook, Word and industry internet sites
* Basic written, verbal, and active listening communication skills with a customer\\-oriented approach
* Basic mathematical skills to ensure the administration of accurate drug and fluid doses
* Basic analytical, critical thinking, judgement, and problem\\-solving skills
* Compassion and empathy for both pets and pet owners
* Interact with a variety of clients and employees in a professional, caring, compassionate, and tactful manner
* Strong attention to detail and high level of accuracy
* Strong organizational and time management skills, including managing multiple priorities
* Handle and maintain sensitive and confidential information with discretion
* Maintain a calm demeanor in a work environment that fluctuates from orderly to fast paced and stressful

**WORKING CONDITIONS/PHYSICAL DEMANDS:**


While performing the duties of this job, the team member is regularly required to talk and hear. The team member must frequently use a computer for long periods of time. Specific vision abilities are required to do this job including close vision. This position requires walking, standing, and sitting for long periods of time. May be exposed to low to moderate noise levels as well as disinfectant/sanitation chemicals, pet dander, and excretions. May experience aggressive, frightened, abused or injured pets that bite and scratch. This position requires exerting up to 40 pounds of force occasionally, and/or 20 pounds frequently, and/or 10 pounds constantly in order to lift, carry, pull or move objects. Ability to work flexible hours including evenings and weekends.

**BENEFITS:**

* 401(k) with employer matching
* Health, Dental, and Vision insurance
* Life and ADD insurance
* Employee assistance program
* Health Savings Account with employer contribution
* Generous paid time off
* License\\-renewal reimbursement and Continuing Education allowance
* Professional development assistance, including annual stipend and study groups for CVT programs
* Quarterly bonuses
* Flexible scheduling with no overnights or Sunday shifts

title: Food & Beverage Internship
description:
At Loews Hotels at Universal Orlando, our team members get to make a difference and have fun every day. Our world\\-class team brings to life the incredible, award\\-winning hotels located at Universal Orlando Resort.


Named one of Central Florida's Top Workplaces and one of America's Best\\-in\\-State Employers by Forbes, we are committed to our "power of we" culture.


Are you looking for a place where you can bring your authentic self to work every day and be able to connect, engage and delight?


* We offer excellent benefits and perks including one free meal per shift and free theme park access.
* We have a dynamic culture that makes every day interesting, challenging, fulfilling and fun.
* We embrace diversity at our core and offer the opportunity for all team members to reach their potential.
* We invest in training and development opportunities for all team members.
* We promote social responsibility by being a good neighbor in the community.
* We care for you, just as we care for others.

**Purpose:**
------------


Internship students will be immersed in various aspects of Food \\& Beverage and our culture of creating enriching experiences at Loews Hotels \\& Co. From guest service standards across different restaurant styles to pool\\-side operations and our extensive meetings and banquets, our F\\&B team plays a critical role in delivering memorable hospitality every single day.


Food \\& Beverage Internships are available at the following properties during select semesters in 2024: New York City, Tucson, Kansas City, and multiple Loews Hotels at Universal Orlando including Loews Royal Pacific, Loews Sapphire Falls, Loews Hard Rock Hotels, Loews Portofino Bay.


Competitive internship pay rate offered. Please discuss location specific details with a member of our Talent Acquisition team during your campus career fair or interviews.


**What Will You Learn?**
------------------------


The Loews Hotels \\& Co F\\&B internship has 4 enriching components:

* Learning Plan
* Mentoring by a Loews Leader(s)
* Reflections
* Value\\-Added Experiences


Experience working with:

* Restaurant, Banquets \\& Meetings
* Barista, Pool/Beach\\-side service, and specialty outlets
* Overview of related departments such as culinary


Learning plans include:

  

* Fundamental practices such as service standards across different F\\&B outlets and meetings based on current experience level
* Menu knowledge
* POS training
* Opening and closing procedures
* Setup standards
* Guest service fundamentals and more
* Bar/wine knowledge, local flavor partner and more
* Value\\-added internship experiences include immersion in Loews culture by experiencing our organizational programs focused on Team Member Engagement, DEI (Diversity, Equity \\& Inclusion), and Learning \\& Development.


Mentors will provide:

* Helpful professional feedback and support during your experience.
* Exposure to leadership tasks
* Understanding F\\&B management reports
* Students will be responsible for completing their weekly reflections in order to capture their learning and maximize the mentoring experience


**What You Bring**

* Students must be currently enrolled in an accredited, US\\-based college or university, and be in good academic standing, in order to apply for an internship.
* Positive attitude, strong work ethic and eagerness to learn
* Desire and ability to work with others collaboratively
* Excellent communication skills \\- both oral and written
* Exceptional guest service skills
* Effective organizational skills with a focus on details, quality, and consistency
* Ability to work flexible schedule to include some weekends and holidays


NOTE: If your campus has specific internship requirements (semester dates, projects, hours/week, etc.) please let our Talent Acquisition representative know at the time of our campus visit and/or interview. Open communication about your campus requirements as well as your career goals will help us ensure an enriching and educational internship experience.

*Loews Hotels \\& Co is an Equal Opportunity Employer that does not discriminate on the basis of actual or perceived race, color, creed, religion, national origin, ancestry, citizenship status, age, sex or gender (including pregnancy, childbirth and pregnancy\\-related conditions), gender identity or expression (including transgender status), sexual orientation, marital status, military service and veteran status, physical or mental disability, genetic information, or any other characteristic protected by applicable federal, state or local laws and ordinances.*

title: Vice President Information Technology
description:
The Talent Source is pleased to partner with a leading
 **services provider** 
 entering a phase of
 **transformative growth** 
 in the search for a visionary
 **Vice President of IT** 
 to architect, implement, and scale a secure technology foundation. Reporting directly to the CEO, this strategic leader will join the executive team and steer the digital roadmap to support new market opportunities, service lines, and potential M\\&A initiatives.
 



  





 Key Responsibilities
 


* **Technology Strategy \\& Transformation**
* Define and execute a future\\-forward IT strategy encompassing ERP, CRM, HCM, and digital platforms.
* Identify and integrate emerging technologies (e.g., AI/ML, RPA) to drive innovation and competitive advantage.
* **Leadership \\& Team Development**
* Build, develop, and inspire a high\\-performing IT team, fostering a culture of innovation, collaboration, and continuous improvement.
* Champion transparent communication between IT and other business units to ensure alignment with organizational priorities.
* **Infrastructure \\& Operations**
* Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of enterprise\\-wide infrastructure, applications, and security.
* Establish best practices for service delivery, cybersecurity, and business continuity, ensuring robust, scalable, and secure operations.
* **Stakeholder \\& Vendor Management**
* Collaborate with cross\\-functional leaders to identify technology requirements, prioritize initiatives, and deliver measurable ROI.
* Develop and manage relationships with external IT partners and vendors, optimizing performance, costs, and overall value.



  





 Qualifications
 


* **Leadership Experience** 
 : 10\\+ years of progressive IT leadership experience, including 5\\+ years in senior management roles.
* **Enterprise Systems Expertise** 
 : Proven success implementing and optimizing ERP, Salesforce, and CPQ platforms.
* **Digital Transformation** 
 : Track record of driving large\\-scale tech initiatives, leveraging data analytics and modern frameworks (Agile, DevOps).
* **Security \\& Risk Management** 
 : Deep knowledge of cybersecurity best practices and risk mitigation strategies.
* **Educational Background** 
 : Bachelor’s degree required; advanced degree (MBA or related) strongly preferred.



  





 Why Join?
 


* **High\\-Impact Leadership** 
 : Shape an organization’s IT strategy at a pivotal time of rapid expansion.
* **Innovation\\-Focused Culture** 
 : Join a leadership team committed to technology investment and continuous improvement.
* **Top Workplace** 
 : Be part of a company recognized with a 2023 Best Places to Work accolade.
* **Competitive Compensation** 
 : Comprehensive benefits and opportunities for professional growth.



  





**Ready to Drive Transformation?** 




 If you’re a forward\\-thinking technology executive eager to make a significant impact, we want to hear from you.
 



  





*The Talent Source is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer.*

title: IT Manager
description:
**Company Description**
 KLH Industries is a family\\-owned precision machine shop specializing in custom\\-made, high\\-quality parts tailored to customer specifications. We offer a wide range of machining services, including EDM, CNC, waterjet, and advanced inspection capabilities, all designed to exceed customer expectations. Serving industries such as aerospace, defense, medical, and more, KLH has earned a reputation for reliability and excellence, with over 70% of our customers returning for repeat business within the same year.
   

  

**Job Description**
 The IT Manager is responsible for the information technology and systems required to support the organization, including day\\-to\\-day execution. This role must be able to recognize the difference between strategy and execution and know when each is appropriate. As a member of the leadership team, the IT Manager contributes to overall business strategies and results while ensuring the company’s IT infrastructure remains secure, compliant, and efficient.
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Infrastructure
+ Lead small\\- and large\\-scale technology projects, including installation, upgrade, and maintenance.
+ Manage technology assets, including inventory of hardware, software, and equipment.
+ Maintain and optimize applications, including ERP and CAD systems.

* Cyber Security
+ Ensure information systems comply with ITAR, NIST 800\\-53, NIST 800\\-171, and CMMC Level 2controls.
+ Review and develop system security plans (SSPs) and plans of action and milestones (POA\\&Ms).
+ Develop new and mature existing information security policies and procedures.
+ Verify and document the implementation of security controls necessary to achieve compliance.
+ Initiate and lead ongoing information security maturity assessments and training.

* Data Storage \\& Use
+ Design systems to collect, automate, and store data in a manner that is organized and accessible.
+ Assist others in performing data\\-related tasks. Facilitate business intelligence actions and insights.
+ Plans, develops, tests, and maintains a business continuity plan for all information systems.

* Strategic Planning
+ Participate in strategic planning sessions with other leadership team members.
+ Create and achieve goals and objectives that align with company strategy.
+ Take an analytical and metrics\\-driven approach to create compelling narratives for solutions.
+ Project manage major initiatives. Define the sequence and timeline of milestones.
+ Participate in creating annual budgets and manage expenditures to operate within budgeted targets.
+ Analyze complex business needs to recommend technology solutions.


 Qualifications
   

  

**Experience \\& Education:**
* At least 3 years of IT management experience is required; 5\\+ years, especially in a manufacturing environment, is a big plus.
* Familiarity with cybersecurity frameworks such as ITAR, NIST 800\\-53, NIST 800\\-171, and NIST CSF is required. Hands\\-on experience with CMMC Level 2 compliance is highly desirable.
* Strong background in technical support, with experience providing daily IT assistance. Experience managing an IT ticketing system is preferred.
* Proficiency in Microsoft technologies, including Office Suite and Exchange (on\\-prem), is required. Experience with MS SQL, SharePoint, Intune, and Purview is preferred.
* Familiarity with cloud infrastructure (AWS, Azure) and virtualization platforms (ESXi, Hyper\\-V), along with experience managing server technologies (Server 2012\\-2025\\), is required. Hands\\-on experience with Azure administration is preferred. Familiarity with Microsoft Radius, WSUS, and Entra is a plus.
* Networking expertise, including VLANs, subnetting, routing, VPNs, MFA, and DHCP, is required. Experience with Cisco, Fortinet, and Aruba is preferred.
* Experience with PowerShell, Python, and deployment automation is highly desirable.
* Ability to manage IT budgeting, vendor negotiations, and contract optimization is highly preferred.


**Skills:**
* Ability to adapt to shifting priorities, start and stop projects as needed, and execute company\\-driven initiatives effectively
* Strong collaboration skills to integrate IT into the overall business strategy and ensure alignment with company objectives
* Resourceful and creative approach to problem\\-solving, finding cost\\-effective solutions within budget constraints
* Strategic mindset with a process\\-oriented approach to IT planning, milestone tracking, and implementation
* Strong communication skills, with the ability to translate technical concepts into business terms and gain stakeholder buy\\-in
* Ability to navigate critical conversations, provide constructive feedback, and advocate for IT best practices
* Technical aptitude with a continuous learning mindset to stay current with evolving technologies


 Additional Information
   

  

*KLH doesn’t just build parts—it builds careers. Grow your skills and help shape the future of manufacturing with KLH as the IT Manager!*
 All your information will be kept confidential according to EEO guidelines.
   

  

 info@panarogroup.com

title: Senior IT Manager
description:
**The Opportunity:**




  





 A permanent role based just North of Denver is seeking an experienced Senior IT leader for a fast\\-growing and thriving organization. This position is open due to the growth and evolution of the organization, which will allow this individual to take ownership and directly see the impact of their technical contributions as well as “own” the IT infrastructure that is vital for company growth. In addition to being the owner of the IT infrastructure strategy/vision, this person will direct new company\\-wide implementations and ongoing oversight of internal platforms.
 



  





 The Manager will operate in a multifaceted capacity and provide a wide array of expertise to deliver a high\\-performing technology platform. To accomplish this, the successful candidate must be equally adept at troubleshooting a technology problem for their direct team as they are in providing leadership\\-level strategy and management of IT operations.
 



  





**The Team:**




  





 As the IT Manager, you will play a pivotal role in driving corporate IT initiatives that empower the organization to achieve its strategic goals. You will lead and support IT functions, ensuring seamless operations across our local and wide area networks, infrastructure, applications programming, and enterprise systems. With a focus on service excellence, you will establish and uphold IT standards, policies, and long\\-term plans that promote efficiency and innovation.
 



  





 Your leadership will be instrumental in identifying and integrating new technologies and tools that enhance the organization’s internal processes and systems management capabilities. You will consistently evaluate technology strategies to ensure they align with the evolving needs of the business, while proactively introducing forward\\-thinking solutions.
 



  





 As a trusted advisor, you will provide strategic direction and hands\\-on support to both onsite and remote stakeholder (employees, contractors, partners and owners), fostering a collaborative environment. This role will require you to work cross\\-functionally (People, Engineering, Security) to ensure we are executing our responsibilities to our partner teams and the business. By guiding the deployment of new technologies and oversight with maintaining existing ones, you will help the organization stay at the forefront of innovation, ensuring that our IT infrastructure serves as a strong foundation for continued growth and success.
 



  





**\\*\\*\\*This will be 100% on\\-site position with some “flex\\-remote” work as time goes on. As such only local candidates in the Denver area will be considered.\\*\\*\\*\\*** 




  





**What You’ll Be Doing:**




  




* Help set the mission and vision of a customer\\-centric IT organization
* Assist with SOX, SOC2, and other compliance efforts
* Lead IT System Administrators and outside vendors
* Establish and manage IT Support and track SLAs and KPIs
* Manage procurement, deployment, and oversight of all endpoints
* Identify requirements for capacity planning, system optimization, scaling, and performance, focusing with the team on ensuring high availability for IT systems
* Communicate effectively with leadership, peers, stakeholders, and end users regarding system and endpoint activities
* Maintain and develop facilities infrastructure, including conference/meeting room technologies, system networks, and physical security
* Identify manual processes and look to automate where appropriate
* Provide technical mentorship to teammates and create and update technical documentation for internal IT teams
* Push the team to industry best practices and drive change
* Be an advocate for our users, understand their challenges, and look to remove blockers



  





**What We’re Looking For:**




  




* 7\\-10\\+ years of related work and/or leadership experience in technology with a verifiable track record of success
* Advanced technology skills and in\\-depth knowledge of technology infrastructure architecture, design, and configuration for WAN/LAN/WLAN networking, cloud, storage, endpoint computing, and operating systems
 **(specifically, MacOS/iOS)**
* Leadership experience, including managing, hiring and retaining top talent a plus
* Demonstrated record of partnering with senior executives to understand complex business problems and successfully apply appropriate technologies
* Experience working in a
 **heavy SaaS\\-based environment**
* A positive attitude and excitement for building new processes and policies for a growing organization while understanding the importance of security and compliance
* Experience in continuous improvement initiatives throughout Infrastructure focused on operational efficiency, service quality, and governance/compliance.
* Attention to detail with strong documentation skills Compensation: $130,000\\-150,000



  





**Benefits:**




  




* Compensation and bonus commensurate with experience
* Excellent Medical benefits with multiple plan offerings and HSA contribution, as well as Dental and Vision plans
* A dynamic, talented team, dedicated to changing the world and building an incredible business
* Onsite and virtual social events to keep us connected in our hybrid work environment

title: Sr IT Manager
description:
The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco\\-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?
 



  





 The Enterprise Data center and Network (DCN) Organization designs, implements and operates a state\\-of\\-the\\-art Information Systems Infrastructure serving around 110,000 employees, in over 700 locations across 65 plus countries. We work with the latest and emerging technologies to deliver scalable, high performing, always available infrastructure services around the world. We deliver services that connect, host, virtualize, store, collaborate, integrate, compute and transact business solutions that utilizes cloud first, automation, analytics, “as a Service”, BIG data and software defined. The Sr IT Manager within the Connectivity team is a key role in the development, delivery implementation and operational support of Network services at designated branch site
 



 Role available in 5 locations: Phoenix, Atlanta, Charlotte, Houston, Raleigh, NC
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop Next\\-Generation architecture SDWAN, Extranet, Wireless, Campus Switching, Backbone Routing.
* Work closely with Operational Architects to accelerate new technology and design pattern validations
* Be the Functional SDWAN, Campus, Wireless, Global Core Backbone for the EA (enterprise Architecture) organization.
* Develop technical strategies to transform SDWAN, Wireless, Campus Switching, Datacenter Micro segmentation.
* Work closely with MADS Leadership to accelerate M\\&A, Divest, Spinco related Network Deliverables.
* Collaborate closely with senior leadership and cross\\-functional teams to modernize Networks.
* Closely work with factory/operational technology teams to understand the end\\-to\\-end operational workflow and help designing standard network architecture
* You will function as the Subject Matter Expert for Data Center Network infrastructure based on a standard architecture



  





**YOU MUST HAVE** 



* 10\\+ years Network Infrastructure experience
* 5\\+ years SDWAN design, implementation \\& Operations
* Proven experience of Managing the Delivery of an SD\\-WAN project
* In\\-Depth Switching and Routing Knowledge
* Proficiency in Enterprise Architecture framework, principles, and tools
* Experience managing relationships with vendors.
* High\\-pace environment with extreme ownership to deliver on commitments
* Ability to set priorities and remain flexible in a changing environment.
* Acting with a sense of urgency; a bias for action and speed
* Ability to make the complex simple and speak/write clearly and succinctly.



  





**WE VALUE** 




  




* Working knowledge of hyper converged server environment, and software defined networking technologies
* Experience designing \\& implementing SDWAN platforms like Cisco, Juniper, Versa.
* Experience with ServiceNow or another similar formal Service Management platform and/or methodology
* Hands on experience and advanced knowledge with stackable switching, software defined access and wireless assurance
* Skills in partnering with internal customers at all levels to define problems, identify solutions, and facilitate change
* Skill/proven ability to analyze complex problems and break them down into logical, actionable parts.
* Experience with data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery options, configuration and execution
* Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision
* Creative and collaborative problem\\-solving capability
* Conveys specific, observable, and/or measurable expectations for each assignment, and verifies understanding and agreement on deliverables and timeframes
* Advanced Troubleshooting and problem resolution skills in working with complex network environment
* CCNA, CCNP, CISSP Certification
* The ability to partner effectively across IT teams, suppliers and business customers on cross\\-functional projects and process improvements
* The ability to translate business issues / requirements and objectives into technical solutions
* Strong knowledge of IT business processes and practices including ITIL methodology
* Experience with data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery options, configuration and execution
* Strong interpersonal skills \\- effective listening and teaming
* Self\\-motivated, demonstrated bias for action
* The ability to be a change agent and promote positive change in the organization demonstrating drive for continual improvement and efficiency
* Excellent oral, written and collaborative communication skills, including executive level communications
* OTHER
* Travel less than 20%

title: Executive Director, Information Technology (IT)
description:
Neurodegenerative diseases are one of the largest medical challenges of our time. Denali Therapeutics is a biotechnology company dedicated to developing breakthrough therapies for neurodegenerative diseases through our deep commitment to degeneration biology and principles of translational medicine. Denali is founded on the collaboration of leading scientists, industry experts, and investors who share the vision that scientific discovery energetically applied to translational medicine is the key to delivering effective therapies to patients.
   

  

 We invite you to consider an opportunity with Denali to help achieve our goal of delivering meaningful therapeutics to patients.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities/Core Job Responsibilities**
**Strategic Leadership and Vision**
* Development and implementation of comprehensive IT strategies that align with Denali’s mission and organizational goals. This includes understanding Denali’s broader business objectives, synthesizing, and translating technology strategies that enable our portfolio and commercial goals. You will collaborate with executive leadership to influence company\\-wide technology decisions and ensure that IT investments are strategically focused on driving growth and efficiency.


**Commercial IT Focus**
* You will partner with Denali’s commercial teams to support technology strategies and execution in the planning, marketing and sales of our drug products. You will Implement technology solutions that enhance customer engagement, improve market positioning, improve commercial insights and stay informed about industry trends and emerging technologies relevant to commercial operations. Your previous experience and insights will contribute to strengthening our competitive position in the market.


**IT Portfolio Governance**
* Establish and oversee IT portfolio management processes to ensure alignment of IT projects and initiatives with business objectives and the business planning cycle. You will evaluate and prioritize IT investments, identify resource allocation needs across projects and programs, and implement governance strategies to manage project risks, interdependencies, and value realization. Regularly monitor and report on the performance of the IT project portfolio to leadership providing transparency and facilitating informed decision\\-making.


**Authentic Technical Leadership**
* You will exemplify authentic technical leadership by leveraging your extensive technical expertise to provide insightful and accurate guidance on IT strategies and initiative to make informed decisions rooted in evidence, industry best practices, and proven methodologies by sharing knowledge and insights openly and honestly, ensuring all communications are grounded in factual information, you will foster transparency and trust within the team and across the organization.


**Cultural Leadership and Community Engagement**
* Actively participate in Denali activities and functions, building culture and relationships in a meaningful and professional manner with your colleagues. You will promote a positive environment by demonstrating respect, integrity, inclusiveness, and dedication in all endeavors, fostering a collaborative and supportive environment.


**Effective Communication and Collaboration**
* Deliver clear and impactful communications to the company, leadership, and the executive team articulating IT’s vision and progress in a straightforward and understandable manner. You will build strong relationships across all levels of the organization, enhancing collaboration and cultural cohesion. Your ability to convey complex technical concepts clearly and succinctly will ensure that messages are easily understood by technical and non\\-technical audiences alike.


**Governance, Compliance, and Risk Management**
* Establish and enforce IT policies, standards, and procedures to ensure compliance with regulatory requirements and industry best practices. Drive IT risk management activities, including healthcare compliance, data privacy, cybersecurity, and disaster recovery planning, ensuring that all initiatives are rooted in solid data and proven methodologies.


**Operational Excellence and Results Orientation**
* Oversee key IT functions—including infrastructure, applications, and support services—to ensure operational excellence. You will manage large\\-scale IT projects, ensuring they are delivered on time, within scope, and within budget, demonstrating strong organizational and prioritization skills. By implementing processes and methodologies that enhance efficiency and effectiveness, you will drive initiatives forward independently, requiring minimal supervision.


**Financial Management and Accountability**
* Develop and manage budgets for assigned IT functions and projects, ensuring cost\\-effective utilization of resources. You will analyze and report on IT performance metrics, ROI, and value delivery to leadership, demonstrating your ability to evaluate and justify significant IT investments.


**Leadership and Team Development**
* Lead and mentor IT managers and teams, including leading direct report(s) through annual goal setting, growth planning, adherence to company policies, maintain training compliance and provide ongoing feedback on growth, development and areas of improvement. Through this, you will a instill a culture of innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement and will inspire high performance by motivating teams to achieve exceptional results and encouraging them to go beyond the status quo. By identifying and developing future leaders within the IT department, you will contribute to our talent management strategies and promote professional growth among team members.


**Qualifications/Skills**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, Business Administration, or a related field; MBA preferred
* 15\\+ years of progressive experience in information technology with 10\\+ years in senior leadership roles within large, complex organizations.
* At least 5 years in the pharmaceutical or healthcare industry, focusing on commercial IT operations
* Demonstrated success in developing and implementing IT strategies that drive business growth, efficiency, and innovation.
* Substantial experience in a technical discipline (e.g. engineering, coding, system development) with the ability to contribute directly to technical work alongside development teams.
* Proficient in cloud computing, data analytics, and enterprise systems.
* Experience leading enterprise architecture and system design initiatives.
* Proficient in core IT frameworks and standards, including ITIL, COBIT, TOGAF, ISO/IEC 27001, NIST Cybersecurity Framework, and CIS Controls
* Experience in IT financial planning and management, including budgeting and cost optimization.
* Strong ability to evaluate and justify significant IT investments
* Professional certifications such as PMP (Project Management Professional), ITIL (Information Technology Infrastructure Library), or CISSP (Certified Information Systems Security Professional) are highly desirable


 Salary Range: $257,373\\.00 to $294,500\\.00 . Compensation for the role will depend on a number of factors, including a candidate’s qualifications, skills, competencies, and experience. Denali offers a competitive total rewards package, which includes a 401k, healthcare coverage, ESPP and a broad range of other benefits. Learn more at https://www.denalitherapeutics.com/careers
   

  

 This compensation and benefits information is based on Denali’s good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future.This compensation and benefits information is based on Denali’s good faith estimate as of the date of publication and may be modified in the future.
   

  

 Denali is committed to its core company value of unity by creating a diverse and inclusive environment. We are proud to be an equal opportunity employer and do not discriminate against any employee or applicant for employment because of race, color, sex, age, national origin, religion, sexual orientation, gender identity and/or expression, status as a veteran, basis of disability, or any other federal, state, or local protected class.

title: Director of IT
description:
**Compensation** 
 : $150K\\-$200K
   

  

**Location** 
 : Norman, OK
   

  

**Position** 
 : Director of IT
   

  

 Inceed has partnered with a great company to help find a skilled
 **Director of IT** 
 to join their team!
   

  

**Responsibilities:**
* Develop and execute a strategic IT roadmap that supports business objectives and manufacturing operations.
* Collaborate with executive leadership to align IT initiatives with the company’s strategic vision.
* Integrate and manage emerging technologies, including automation, IoT, and smart manufacturing.
* Lead and develop an IT team, fostering a high\\-performance culture and professional growth.
* Oversee network, server, and cloud infrastructure to ensure a secure and high\\-performing IT environment.
* Manage IT projects from conception to implementation, ensuring timely and high\\-quality delivery.
* Strengthen cybersecurity measures and ensure compliance with global regulatory standards.
* Develop and maintain disaster recovery and business continuity plans.
* Partner with financial leaders to align IT investments with budgetary goals and optimize resource allocation.


**Required Qualifications \\& Experience:**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* 7\\+ years of IT leadership/management experience, preferably in the manufacturing sector.
* Expertise in IT solutions for manufacturing, including ERP systems (SAP, Oracle, Infor, or Microsoft Dynamics), MES, and Industry 4\\.0 innovations (AI, IoT, Big Data Analytics).
* Proven experience managing and optimizing hybrid cloud infrastructures.
* Strong understanding of cybersecurity models, security best practices, and regulatory compliance.
* Track record of directing IT operations and maintaining robust infrastructure across multiple locations.
* Proficiency in Microsoft 365 solutions and cross\\-functional team leadership.
* Excellent project management, verbal, and written communication skills.


**Nice to Have Skills \\& Experience:**
* MBA or an advanced degree.
* Experience with Infor Syteline, HubSpot CRM, and Google Cloud platforms.
* Knowledge of Lean methodologies or Shingo principles.
* Experience managing IT operations across international locations.
* Background in IT governance, risk mitigation, and compliance with global standards.


**Perks \\& Benefits:**
* Comprehensive benefits package available.

title: Director of Information Technology (Ops)
description:
**Director, Information Technology Operations!** 




*Must be currently working in a Director level or higher role and have done so for an enterprise\\-size company. No sponsorship or relocations!* 




  





 We are seeking a highly technical and experienced Director of IT Operations to provide strategic and hands\\-on leadership to our 24/7/365 IT Operations teams. This critical role focuses heavily on overseeing our IT HelpDesk, Network Operations Center (NOC), Incident Management, Disaster Recovery and Business Continuity (DR/BC), and system monitoring and alerting functions. The ideal candidate will have a strong technical background in enterprise\\-scale environments and demonstrate expertise with ITIL and Service Management processes, ideally leveraging ServiceNow.
 



**Key Responsibilities:** 




 As the Director of IT Operations, you will lead diverse technical teams, including the IT HelpDesk, Network Operations Center (NOC), and DR/BC groups. You will provide strategic direction, mentorship, and cultivate a high\\-performance culture while aligning the IT Operations strategy with broader business objectives. Establishing and monitoring operational performance metrics (KPIs) will be crucial to continuously optimizing team processes and effectiveness. You will ensure the delivery of reliable, secure, and high\\-performance IT services, managing all aspects of user support and incident management to maintain seamless user experiences.
 



 Additionally, you will drive proactive identification, response, and resolution of incidents, minimizing disruption and adhering to SLAs. Through comprehensive root cause analyses, you will identify and resolve systemic issues to enhance system stability. Your role will include overseeing the continuous improvement and management of enterprise IT infrastructure, ensuring optimal performance, availability, and scalability.
 



 In partnership with Information Security teams, you will uphold robust security measures, ensuring compliance with industry standards such as GDPR, HIPAA, and PCI. Effective vendor and stakeholder management will also be critical, ensuring alignment with organizational goals and contractual obligations.
 



 Your responsibilities will encompass budget management, including the procurement and oversight of IT hardware, software, and services. You will champion process automation and continuous improvement initiatives, leveraging ITIL frameworks to refine service delivery and incident management processes. Furthermore, you will manage structured change management processes to facilitate smooth system updates and deployments.
 



  





**Required Experience:** 




 We are seeking candidates with at least 15 years of progressive IT experience, including a minimum of 10 years in senior leadership roles within complex enterprise environments. Ideal candidates will have extensive experience leading teams across IT HelpDesk, Network Operations Centers (NOC), Incident Management, Disaster Recovery/Business Continuity (DR/BC), and monitoring and alerting functions. Candidates must possess deep technical proficiency in managing enterprise\\-level IT infrastructures, along with a comprehensive understanding of ITIL methodologies and Service Management practices, particularly utilizing ServiceNow. Must be familiar supporting 24/7/265 environments and working closely with security teams.
 



  





**Education \\& Certifications:** 



* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or related field
* Certifications in ITIL would be a nice plus

title: Sr IT Manager
description:
The future is what you make it. When you join Honeywell, you become a member of our global team of thinkers, innovators, dreamers and doers who make the things that make the future. That means changing the way we fly, fueling jets in an eco\\-friendly way, keeping buildings smart and safe and even making it possible to breathe on Mars. Working at Honeywell isn’t just about developing cool things. That’s why all of our employees enjoy access to dynamic career opportunities across different fields and industries. Are you ready to help us make the future?
 



  





 The Enterprise Data center and Network (DCN) Organization designs, implements and operates a state\\-of\\-the\\-art Information Systems Infrastructure serving around 110,000 employees, in over 700 locations across 65 plus countries. We work with the latest and emerging technologies to deliver scalable, high performing, always available infrastructure services around the world. We deliver services that connect, host, virtualize, store, collaborate, integrate, compute and transact business solutions that utilizes cloud first, automation, analytics, “as a Service”, BIG data and software defined. The Sr IT Manager within the Connectivity team is a key role in the development, delivery implementation and operational support of Network services at designated branch site
 



 Role available in 5 locations: Phoenix, Atlanta, Charlotte, Houston, Raleigh, NC
 



  





**Key Responsibilities:** 



* Develop Next\\-Generation architecture SDWAN, Extranet, Wireless, Campus Switching, Backbone Routing.
* Work closely with Operational Architects to accelerate new technology and design pattern validations
* Be the Functional SDWAN, Campus, Wireless, Global Core Backbone for the EA (enterprise Architecture) organization.
* Develop technical strategies to transform SDWAN, Wireless, Campus Switching, Datacenter Micro segmentation.
* Work closely with MADS Leadership to accelerate M\\&A, Divest, Spinco related Network Deliverables.
* Collaborate closely with senior leadership and cross\\-functional teams to modernize Networks.
* Closely work with factory/operational technology teams to understand the end\\-to\\-end operational workflow and help designing standard network architecture
* You will function as the Subject Matter Expert for Data Center Network infrastructure based on a standard architecture



  





**YOU MUST HAVE** 



* 10\\+ years Network Infrastructure experience
* 5\\+ years SDWAN design, implementation \\& Operations
* Proven experience of Managing the Delivery of an SD\\-WAN project
* In\\-Depth Switching and Routing Knowledge
* Proficiency in Enterprise Architecture framework, principles, and tools
* Experience managing relationships with vendors.
* High\\-pace environment with extreme ownership to deliver on commitments
* Ability to set priorities and remain flexible in a changing environment.
* Acting with a sense of urgency; a bias for action and speed
* Ability to make the complex simple and speak/write clearly and succinctly.



  





**WE VALUE** 




  




* Working knowledge of hyper converged server environment, and software defined networking technologies
* Experience designing \\& implementing SDWAN platforms like Cisco, Juniper, Versa.
* Experience with ServiceNow or another similar formal Service Management platform and/or methodology
* Hands on experience and advanced knowledge with stackable switching, software defined access and wireless assurance
* Skills in partnering with internal customers at all levels to define problems, identify solutions, and facilitate change
* Skill/proven ability to analyze complex problems and break them down into logical, actionable parts.
* Experience with data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery options, configuration and execution
* Effectively demonstrates ability to deliver on complex situations or problems without guidance or supervision
* Creative and collaborative problem\\-solving capability
* Conveys specific, observable, and/or measurable expectations for each assignment, and verifies understanding and agreement on deliverables and timeframes
* Advanced Troubleshooting and problem resolution skills in working with complex network environment
* CCNA, CCNP, CISSP Certification
* The ability to partner effectively across IT teams, suppliers and business customers on cross\\-functional projects and process improvements
* The ability to translate business issues / requirements and objectives into technical solutions
* Strong knowledge of IT business processes and practices including ITIL methodology
* Experience with data protection, business continuity and disaster recovery options, configuration and execution
* Strong interpersonal skills \\- effective listening and teaming
* Self\\-motivated, demonstrated bias for action
* The ability to be a change agent and promote positive change in the organization demonstrating drive for continual improvement and efficiency
* Excellent oral, written and collaborative communication skills, including executive level communications
* OTHER
* Travel less than 20%

title: Director of Information Technology
description:
The Director of Information Technology will lead the strategic direction, implementation, and management of information technology at Nexus Engineering Group. This role is responsible for ensuring that IT initiatives align with company\\-wide goals, optimizing technology investments, and delivering systems that enhance productivity, efficiency, and security. The IT Director will collaborate with leadership, department heads, and end\\-users to drive value through technology while maintaining cost\\-effectiveness. Key responsibilities include overseeing IT strategy, budgeting, vendor management, cybersecurity, infrastructure, and employee training. This role will also ensure that information systems, network services, and applications are continuously optimized to support business operations and future growth.
   

  

**Key Accountabilities**
* Ensure IT strategy and initiatives align with company\\-wide business goals
* Develop and manage the IT budget, collaborating with the CFO, COO, and Department Heads
* Establish and enforce IT policies, including cybersecurity, system management, and employee technology use
* Oversee contract negotiations with IT vendors to optimize cost and service
* Communicate IT costs, value, risks, and performance to management through KPI dashboards
* Develop and maintain business continuity and disaster recovery plans
* Ensure compliance with client IT security requirements and industry regulations
* Drive continuous improvement and innovation in technology systems


**Key Responsibilities**
* Lead and manage IT infrastructure, ensuring system reliability, scalability, and performance
* Optimize information systems and applications, including licensing, versioning, and system administration
* Implement and maintain cybersecurity measures to protect company and client data
* Support engineering software (AutoCAD, Revit, Bentley Systems, Primavera P6\\) and ensure seamless integration across project management tools
* Provide IT support for remote teams, mobile users, and field engineers
* Oversee IT support services, ensuring timely resolution of hardware, software, and network issues

* Stay ahead of emerging technologies to improve workflow efficiency, productivity, and profitability
* Improve IT automation and integration to streamline processes and enhance cross\\-departmental collaboration


**Experience And Expertise**
