title: Senior Manager, IT Asset and CMDB
description:
**Vonage IT Mission:** 
 We define, implement, and enforce strong security and compliance processes through the application of technical solutions and automation to drive efficiencies and enforce compliance. Security, Privacy, Trust, and Compliance by design are at the core of our organization’s mission and objectives. We leverage technology and best practices to provide world\\-class business application and user support across Vonage’s global organization. We partner with the business to understand their current and future needs, define, develop, deliver and maintain business systems, data management/storage, network systems and desktop support. We integrate business requirements with technology alternatives, taking into consideration business criticality, timing and cost implications. We apply creativity and state\\-of\\-the\\-art technical understanding to ensure our systems provide business, team and individual value.
   

  

**Why This Role Matters**
 This role will support a larger critical initiative for the organization. As Vonage builds processes and implements tools for IT Asset Management (ITAM) and a Configuration Management Database (CMDB), this role will be key in driving the building of a team and delivering a world class ITAM and CMDB function. The individual in this role will demonstrate subject matter expertise in CMDB and ITAM principles. As a Senior Manager IT Asset Management and CMDB, the candidate is expected to successfully build and lead a team that will deliver and maintain a world class function that is key to Vonage’s IT strategy.
   

  

***IF THIS SOUNDS LIKE YOU, CONTINUE READING BELOW…….***
**What You Will Do**
* Oversee the overall management and accuracy of a Configuration Management Database (CMDB), ensuring data quality, defining data models, establishing processes for data entry and updates, collaborating with stakeholders to gather necessary information, and monitoring compliance with CMDB standards to maintain a reliable and up\\-to\\-date view of the IT infrastructure.
* Implement and maintain discovery, providing governance to ensure data completeness and accuracy.
* Design and maintain the CMDB data model, including CI relationships.
* Develop and document processes for data entry, updates, and retirement.
* Review and approve updates to CMDB attributes and classifications.
* Monitor and review data inconsistencies and remediate as needed.
* Develop IT asset lifecycle management policies and standards to be adhered to across the organization by asset owners.
* Implement processes for governance for adherence to standards and policies by asset owners.
* Develop metrics and key performance indicators (KPI) to track and report on asset management inventory and lifecycle.
* Accountable for creating and maintaining the consolidated asset inventory.
* Exhibit strong communication, collaboration and conflict management skills to establish and maintain relationships with IT, business functions, customers, and 3rd parties.


**What You Will Bring**
* Broad technical knowledge across multiple IT platforms and processes
* Experience performing data analysis in support of ITAM and CMDB
* Experience leading global teams
* Ability to educate, follow up, and influence stakeholders to ensure compliance with standards and policies
* Strong interpersonal and communication skills


**What Is In It For You**
 In addition to providing exciting work, career advancement opportunities, and a collaborative work environment, Vonage provides competitive pay and benefits including unlimited discretionary time off and tuition reimbursement.

title: IT Infrastructure Sr. Director
description:
We have a need for an IT Infrastructure Leader to join our team in Atlanta, GA. This role will be onsite.
 



  





**IT Infrastructure Director Qualifications:** 




  





 Infrastructure Engineering and Operations management experience dealing with Windows, UNIX (Red Hat Linux, Solaris, HP\\-UX, AIX), Cisco Networks, DevOps, Cloud, Databases (Oracle, SQL Server, MySQL, DB2\\), Storage \\& Backups, and Security.
 



  





**Prior technology consulting background highly preferred. Exposure to multiple clients and diverse technical environments greatly desired.** 




  




* Bachelor's Degree or higher in Engineering, Technology or related field or commensurate work experience.
* Any Systems or Network Certifications or equivalent preferred.
* ITIL certification preferred.
* 7\\+ years of IT Management experience with a history of taking on additional leadership functions and promotions.
* Experience in handling multiple concurrent complex priorities and high severity operation incidents within a technical environment
* Experience leading and developing a team of IT Infrastructure professionals.
* Experience moving Infrastructure \\& Applications to the Cloud. AWS is preferred.
* Excellent management skills, including experience in the development of management reports, time management and organization skills, and ability to delegate authority and tasks
* Software application proficiency with Microsoft Office Suite with extensive experience with MS PowerPoint, MS Excel and MS Word
* Ability to develop and maintain positive working relationships within all levels from direct reports to their reports while coordinating with peers to drive deliverables
* Strong communication skills with both internal staff and clients



  





**IT Infrastructure Director PROFILE:** 



* The ideal candidate will need to bring a mix of hard and soft skills in order to ensure his/her success.
* Given the scope of contribution of this role, it will be imperative that qualified candidates bring experience obtains through larger consulting firm or from a dynamically changing Infrastructure team.
* A background including B2B services, transaction / payment processing, and credit card services would be strongly preferred.
* Qualified candidates will have a background and comfort level working with diverse systems.
* He/She will bring an appetite for keeping current with new technology solutions, and be incredibly passionate about solving business problems through the use of technology. business problems through the use of technology.
* This person will need to bring a track record of hands\\-on, ‘doing’ – being personally responsible for the strategy, execution and success of systems that have been global in nature and have impacted the bottom\\-line efficiency and success of an organization.
* Ideally, qualified candidates will have an experience base that involves multi\\-national Infrastructure \\& software development.
* This ‘doing’ sometimes will involve hours flexing over different time zones depending on areas of business focus, acquisition due diligence, etc.
* He/She will know how to quickly craft a written proposal and solution strategy, in addition to being comfortable with the responsibility of the hands\\-on execution work involved.
* In addition, qualified candidates will bring executive level communication, decision, and presentation skills with all levels of business management.
* This should be an individual with a sense of both independence and urgency. He/She should have a solid background of autonomy and seeing initiatives through from beginning to end, with business impact and ROI defined.
* Our culture is fast\\-paced and dynamic. Someone who is looking for a lean, swift moving environment will be a good match.
* Additionally, someone looking for an army of support and a great deal of hand holding will not likely be the best fit.
* This position will require an individual who is very comfortable operating in an environment with a company that is experiencing growth both organically and through acquisitions.
* This will require a high degree of interpersonal and influencing skills and an ability to work cross\\-culturally to improve collaboration within IT at the global level.

title: Manager,  IT Operations and Service Delivery
description:
**About Agital**
 Agital is the Impact agency. We’re an integrated marketing company serving clients of all sizes and across a variety of industries with services including paid and organic search, social, and programmatic, public relations (PR), business consulting, marketing automation, website development, UX design, and more. Our team of digital marketing and holistic strategy experts are nimble, using the latest data sourced from our industry\\-leading proprietary software paired with decades of experience to achieve measurable growth.
   

  

 At Agital, we challenge the status quo and embrace innovation and agility to propel our business toward measurable, impactful results. Trust is our currency, and momentum is our mantra. We invest in our people, our clients, and our partners to foster an environment primed for growth.
   

  

 With decades of expertise guiding our insights\\-driven services, we craft revolutionary marketing strategies that seamlessly integrate tech and talent, daring to defy convention and designed for impact.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 Reporting to the SVP, IT and Cybersecurity, you will lead the overall IT and Cyber operations for Agital including central and divisional services. The primary responsibilities of your role will be to:
   

  

* Closely partner with the SVP, IT to effect central IT and Cyber strategy and governance
* Further establish the corporate IT platform as a scalable and agile function throughout the business
* Develop and implement standards and processes for IT and Cyber
* Build a winning team of IT professionals through direct hires and staff development
* Deliver M\\&A and growth related initiatives including major system migrations and consolidations
* Manage a diverse set of partners and internal stakeholders including Agital’s IT MSP
* Manage Cyber risk and secure the organization by integrating effective cybersecurity controls into the delivery of IT services
* Oversee an annual IT and Cyber operating budget


 This role is 100% remote with limited travel expectations.
   

  

**What You Will Bring To Agital**
 You will bring these qualities to the table:
   

  

* Strong business acumen and experience working with leadership across Central Services functions including HR, Finance, Legal, and Marketing
* Keen understanding of value creation in a P/E M\\&A or similar environment, and experience working with portfolio company owners, founders, or other entrepreneurial leaders
* Ability to leverage business knowledge along with a command of IT and Cyber frameworks, standards, controls, and best practices to align IT and Cyber needs to the business
* Tactical expertise in implementing complex IT solutions through effective change management
* Experience working with an outsourced IT operating model and MSP
* An awareness of IT and Cyber risk tolerances and how these align with and are supportive of broader business objectives
* Expertise in business stakeholder engagement and relationship building
* The ability to lead, coach, and inspire others, and grow talent
* A practical, collaborative, and highly service\\-oriented mindset
* Excellent communication, documentation, and presentation skills
* Excellent critical thinking and problem\\-solving skills and ability to ask the right questions to uncover root and causal factors
* High level of personal integrity and ethics, and ability to professionally handle confidential matters and show an appropriate level of judgment and maturity.


**What You Will Do**
* Work closely with the SVP, IT to manage day\\-to day IT and Cyber operations including the MSP and related partners
* Define key processes and SOPs ensuring efficient IT operations and a world\\-class employee experience, e.g. employee onboarding, offboarding, IT support
* Track and manage IT hardware and software assets
* Ensure a high\\-level of quality and employee satisfaction in IT services through measurement and reporting of KPIs
* Develop and maintain a roadmap of IT projects and initiatives supporting business objectives
* Manage IT and division vendor contracts, ensuring licenses and subscriptions are right\\-sized and spend is in line with usage and budget
* Facilitate change management through effective planning, communication, and project/task management
* Provide hands\\-on administration and support serving as the MSP’s primary technical escalation point of contact; this includes occasional end\\-user support
* Work with the SVP, IT and key partners to execute major projects such as systems consolidations, data migration, brand transitions, and deployment of new tools and processes
* Work with the SVP, IT to determine a go\\-forward staffing model and acquire talent supporting the current MSP operating model


**Key Functions**
* IT operations
* Process and change management
* Service delivery and incident escalation
* Systems administration and engineering
* Asset management
* Cybersecurity controls and identity management
* Project and task management
* Talent acquisition and development
* Budgeting and cost management


**What You'll Need**
* BS/BA in IT, Information Systems, or related field
* 5\\+ years previous work experience in IT management in practice lead, manager, or director role
* Extensive experience with Microsoft 365 and Google Workspace including in a hands\\-on capacity administering and configuring these platforms
* Extensive experience managing cloud/SaaS apps for employee productivity, collaboration, and work management (examples Adobe, Atlassian tools, Clickup, Monday.com, Slack, Zoom)
* Experience managing outsourced IT operations including a Managed Services Provider (MSP)
* Detailed understanding and experience implementing technical controls for hardware, cloud services, email, and identity management services
* Excellent working knowledge of IT service management concepts and frameworks such as ITIL
* Excellent working knowledge of Cyber detective and preventative controls, information and data protection
* Conceptual knowledge of privacy and compliance rules and regulations
* Financial and budget planning and management experience
* Certifications including Microsoft, Azure, Google, ITIL, CISSP preferred


****Working At Agital****
 We believe that great work is only possible with great people. We want to find people who believe in our mission, vision and values and feel inspired to grow while they’re here. You have flexibility to work remotely or in one of our offices. We want you to work where you can do your best work.
   

  

****Our People \\& Culture****
 We strive to create an inclusive culture that empowers our people to be who they are, contribute their unique perspectives, and make a difference individually and collectively. It enables us to leverage different ideas and bring more creativity and innovation to everything we do. We want Agital to be one of the most rewarding places you will ever work.
   

  

**What We Offer**
 A dynamic and rewarding work culture! At Agital, we want to improve the state of our world. Each of us has a responsibility to drive equality and inclusion in our communities and workplace. We are committed to hiring and retaining a diverse workforce. We view everyone as an individual, and we understand that inclusion is more than just diversity – it’s about belonging. We celebrate the fact that everyone is unique, and that’s what makes us so good at what we do. We pride ourselves on being a company that embraces difference and truly represents the diverse clients we work with.
   

  

**Benefits \\& Compensation**
 Agital offers a dynamic and rewarding work culture and benefits including—
   

  

* Autonomy – we hire intelligent people and give them the tools and training to succeed.
* Growth Opportunities\\- growing company with room to play a key role at a pivotal time of growth.
* Health insurance
* Unlimited paid\\-time\\-off plan
* 401k with company match
* Company paid life insurance


 Compensation for this role is commensurate with experience and skills.
   

  

**No agencies please. Agital is an equal opportunity employer; all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability status, protected veteran status, or any other characteristic protected by law. This job description may not be complete, and roles and responsibilities may change. We cannot offer visa support at this time.**

title: Senior Manager Information System
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 




**Sojitz Corporation of America (SCA)** 
 is the regional headquarters for Sojitz, a general trading company based in Tokyo, Japan. With a history dating back to 1892, Sojitz is engaged in a wide range of businesses globally, including buying, selling, importing, and exporting goods, manufacturing and selling products, providing services, and planning and coordinating projects, in Japan and overseas. Sojitz also invests in various sectors and conducts financing activities. The broad range of sectors in which Sojitz operations includes automobiles, energy, mineral resources, chemicals, foodstuff resources, agricultural and forestry resources, consumer goods, and industrial parks.
 



  





 Under the general direction of GM and Senior Manager, maintains high performance and integrity of communications and data systems for North/Central/South Americas and Europe by managing projects. Supports implementation of Sojitz Standard Network. This position reports to the Senior Manager, System Planning Support.

* Support designing project plans.
* Monitor progress and identify problems.
* Prepare project cost estimates.



**SECONDARY FUNCTIONS:**

* Maintains professional and technical knowledge by reviewing professional publications and researching information.
* Support IT Security Policy implementation and training.
* Monitor A/R and contact customers for collections.



**POSITION REQUIRES INFRASTRUCTURE RELATED KNOWLEDGE AND SKILLS:** 



* Wide Area Network (WAN)
* Local Area Network (LAN)
* Microsoft environment (M365\\)
* Experience in establishing new office design.



  





**EDUCATION, EXPERIENCE AND SKILLS REQUIRED:** 



* BS in IT/Computer or related field and/or equivalent technical or professional experience. Strong system knowledge of telecommunications, internet, e\\-mail, server, security, PC, MS products, printer/copier, and LAN/WAN.
* Basic knowledge of general accounting/bookkeeping principles.
* Effective interpersonal and communication skills to interact with a wide range of users having different levels of computer expertise.
* Advanced customer service skills.
* Must possess strong analytical, negotiation and sales skills.
* Business travel is required, (approx. 4 months of the year).

title: Chief Technology Officer
description:
**Top\\-Tier Asset Management Company in Manhattan is seeking a Chief Technology Officer!** 




  





**Responsibilities:** 




  




* Oversees and directs the company's technology strategy, ensuring it aligns with business goals and supports innovation, while also managing IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, and technology investments.
* Develop and implement a technology roadmap that aligns with the company's overall business strategy and investment objectives.
* Identify and evaluate new technologies and solutions that can enhance investment processes and improve customer experience.

* Manage IT operations, including software development, network administration, and IT support.
* Ensure compliance with relevant regulations and industry standards.

* Bachelor's Degree

title: Chief Information Officer (CIO)
description:
**About the Company:** 




 Pivotal Solutions is a leading national staffing \\& consulting firm dedicated to connecting top\\-tier professionals with innovative companies. We specialize in identifying and placing exceptional candidates in roles where they can thrive and contribute to business growth. We offer direct hire, contract\\-to\\-hire, and contract/temp staffing \\& consulting services. Our top areas that we staff for include IT \\& Technology, Accounting \\& Finance, Engineering \\& Construction, Supply Chain \\& Operations, Sales \\& Marketing, and HR \\& Administrative positions.
 



  





**About the Role:** 




 Pivotal Solutions is building a Chief Information Officer (CIO) consulting practice across the US and this is a great opportunity to get into consulting engagements when they come up whether part\\-time or full\\-time. If you're a current CIO or looking to step into a CIO role please apply. We also help our clients hire full\\-time employees so if you're looking for a full\\-time employee position please do apply as well! Here is a CIO job description below for the backgrounds we typically look for:
 



  





**Key Responsibilities** 



* **Strategic Leadership** 
 : Develop and execute a comprehensive IT strategy that supports the organization’s long\\-term goals, fosters innovation, and drives operational efficiency.
* **Technology Oversight** 
 : Oversee the design, implementation, and maintenance of all IT systems, including hardware, software, networks, and cybersecurity protocols.
* **Digital Transformation** 
 : Lead initiatives to modernize legacy systems, adopt emerging technologies (e.g., AI, cloud computing, data analytics), and enhance the organization’s digital capabilities.
* **Team Management** 
 : Build, mentor, and manage a high\\-performing IT team, fostering a culture of collaboration, accountability, and continuous improvement.
* **Budget Management** 
 : Develop and manage the IT budget, ensuring cost\\-effective allocation of resources while delivering maximum value to the organization.
* **Risk Management** 
 : Implement robust cybersecurity measures and disaster recovery plans to safeguard company data and ensure compliance with relevant regulations (e.g., GDPR, HIPAA, etc.).
* **Stakeholder Collaboration** 
 : Partner with C\\-suite executives, department heads, and external vendors to align IT initiatives with business needs and deliver seamless technology solutions.
* **Performance Metrics** 
 : Establish and monitor key performance indicators (KPIs) to evaluate the effectiveness of IT systems and processes, reporting progress to the executive team and board.
* **Vendor Management** 
 : Negotiate contracts and manage relationships with technology vendors, service providers, and consultants to ensure quality and cost efficiency.



  





**Qualifications** 



* **Education** 
 : Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Business Administration, or a related field (Master’s degree or MBA preferred).
* **Experience** 
 : Minimum of 10\\+ years of progressive IT leadership experience, with at least 5 years in a senior executive role (e.g., CIO, CTO, or equivalent).
* **Technical Expertise** 
 : Strong knowledge of IT infrastructure, cloud computing, cybersecurity, software development, and enterprise systems (e.g., ERP, CRM).
* **Leadership Skills** 
 : Proven ability to lead cross\\-functional teams, manage large\\-scale projects, and inspire a culture of innovation and excellence.
* **Business Acumen** 
 : Deep understanding of how technology drives business outcomes, with experience aligning IT strategies to revenue growth and operational success.
* **Communication** 
 : Exceptional verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to present complex technical concepts to non\\-technical stakeholders.
* **Certifications** 
 (preferred): PMP, CISSP, ITIL, or other relevant certifications.

title: Director Information Technology
description:
**Description**
 Location: Colorado (80% remote, with some regional travel)
   

  

 Department: UCHealth Technology Services

**We are seeking a dynamic Director of Information Technology to oversee technology infrastructure operations. This role involves overseeing data center operations and infrastructure, voice and data networks, Microsoft O365/Azure, and infrastructure operations management.**

**Preferred**

* Experience with Microsoft 365, Microsoft Azure, Cisco voice and data networks, data center technologies, and EPIC


 At UCHealth, We Improve Lives
   

  

**Summary**
 Directs the department's activities and resources to ensure alignment with the mission, values, and objectives of the department and organization.
   

  

**Responsibilities**

* Plans and monitors staffing activities, including hiring, orienting, evaluating, disciplinary actions and continuing education initiatives.
* Prepares, monitors, and evaluates departmental budgets, and ensures that the department operates in compliance with allocated funding. Coordinates and directs internal/external audits.


 We improve lives. In big ways through learning, healing, and discovery. In small, personal ways through human connection. But in all ways, we improve lives.
   

  

 UCHealth invests in its Workforce.
   

  

 UCHealth offers an Annual Incentive Bonus to recognize employee's contributions to our success in quality, patient experience, organizational growth, financial goals, and tenure with UCHealth.
   

  

 UCHealth offers their employees a competitive and comprehensive total rewards package (benefit eligibility is based off of FTE status):

* Employer\\-paid basic life and accidental death and dismemberment coverage with buy\\-up coverage options
* Employer paid short term disability and long\\-term disability with buy\\-up coverage options
* Wellness benefits

* Education benefits for employees, including the opportunity to be eligible for 100% of tuition, books and fees paid for by UCHealth for specific educational degrees. Other programs may qualify for up to $5,250 pre\\-paid by UCHealth or in the form of tuition reimbursement each calendar year


**Loan Repayment**
* UCHealth is a qualifying employer for the federal Public Service Loan Forgiveness (PSLF) program! UCHealth provides employees with free assistance navigating the PSLF program to submit their federal student loans for forgiveness through Savi.


 UCHealth always welcomes talent. This position will be open for a minimum of three days and until a top applicant is identified.
   

  

 UCHealth recognizes and appreciates the rich array of talents and perspectives that equal employment and diversity can offer our institution. As an equal opportunity employer, UCHealth is committed to making all employment decisions based on valid requirements. No applicant shall be discriminated against in any terms, conditions or privileges of employment or otherwise be discriminated against because of the individual's race, color, national origin, language, culture, ethnicity, age, religion, sex, disability, sexual orientation, gender, veteran status, socioeconomic status, or any other characteristic prohibited by federal, state, or local law. UCHealth does not discriminate against any qualified applicant with a disability as defined under the Americans with Disabilities Act and will make reasonable accommodations, when they do not impose an undue hardship on the organization.

title: Senior Manager Information System
description:
**WHO WE ARE** 




**Sojitz Corporation of America (SCA)** 
 is the regional headquarters for Sojitz, a general trading company based in Tokyo, Japan. With a history dating back to 1892, Sojitz is engaged in a wide range of businesses globally, including buying, selling, importing, and exporting goods, manufacturing and selling products, providing services, and planning and coordinating projects, in Japan and overseas. Sojitz also invests in various sectors and conducts financing activities. The broad range of sectors in which Sojitz operations includes automobiles, energy, mineral resources, chemicals, foodstuff resources, agricultural and forestry resources, consumer goods, and industrial parks.
 



  





 Under the general direction of GM and Senior Manager, maintains high performance and integrity of communications and data systems for North/Central/South Americas and Europe by managing projects. Supports implementation of Sojitz Standard Network. This position reports to the Senior Manager, System Planning Support.

title: Assistant Vice President, Technology Infrastructure, Operations & Security
description:
**Company Overview**
 Pattern Energy is a leading renewable energy company that develops, constructs, owns, and operates high\\-quality wind and solar generation, transmission, and energy storage facilities. Our mission is to transition the world to renewable energy through the sustainable development and responsible operation of facilities with respect for the environment, communities, and cultures where we have a presence.
   

  

 Our approach begins and ends with establishing trust, accountability, and transparency. Our company values of creative spirit, pride of ownership, follow\\-through, and a team\\-first attitude drive us to pursue our mission every day. Our culture supports our values by fostering innovative and critical thinking and a deep belief in living up to our promises.
   

  

 Headquartered in the United States, Pattern has a global portfolio of more than 30 power facilities and transmission assets, serving various customers that provide low\\-cost clean energy to millions of consumers.
   

  

**Responsibilities**
**Job Purpose**
 The AVP, Technology Infrastructure, Operations and Security will be responsible for leading Pattern’s technology operations and ensuring the security and reliability of critical systems in a hybrid IT and OT environment. This senior leader will be responsible for developing and executing a comprehensive IT and OT strategy that supports our business objectives, drives innovation, and mitigates cyber security and reliability risks associated with managing a geographically dispersed renewable energy and transmission infrastructure. The ideal candidate will possess a strong technical background, exceptional leadership skills, a proven track record of managing complex IT and OT environments, encompassing both cloud and on\\-premises infrastructure, deep experience in cyber security practices in regulated environments.
   

  

 In this role, you will collaboratively lead the Enterprise Technology teams: Data Architecture, Business Applications, Information security and OT Operations to deliver integrated solutions to the business, as well as with business operation, regulatory and compliance department leaders and teams.
   

  

* Maintain and execute information security strategy and improvement plan.
* Execute IT and OT technology improvement projects, including delivery of technology for new sites (e.g. SunZia).
* Lead day\\-day IT and OT operations and plan, including implementation of service management processes across Enterprise technology.
* Evaluate and deploy technology solutions to improve collaboration and productivity for the company, while ensuring minimizing impact to existing production systems/infrastructure, Maintain a best\\-in\\-class internal technology for the company.
* Recruit, lead, direct, develop, coach and evaluate direct reports.
* Engage and manage key stakeholder relationships to communicate and review SLAs, understand business needs and drive continuous improvement in service delivery.
* As a member of the Enterprise Technology leadership team, support broader execution of the Enterprise technology and transformation strategy and planning.


**Qualifications**
**Experience/Qualifications/Education Required**
* Bachelor’s degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, Engineering or a related field (Master's degree preferred).
* Minimum of 15\\+ years of progressive experience in IT and OT leadership roles, with a focus on the management of technology infrastructure in a hybrid environment (Cloud and onPremise) ideally within the regulated energy sector.
* Exceptional leadership skills with a track record of leading and inspiring high\\-performing teams (with both internal and external resources) and demonstrated capabilities to influence technology and business leaders.
+ Proven records implementation company\\-wide information security strategies and maintaining a risk\\-based posture, inclusive of IT and OT standards.
+ Proven track record of developing, implementing and managing successful IT and OT technology strategies, including workplace applications (MSFT Teams, WebEx, Office Management Systems, Networks, Laptop and mobile provisioning).
+ Experience managing IT and OT budgets and vendor relationships.
+ Experience implementing disaster recovery plans.


**Additional Requirements**
* Excellent written and verbal communication skills with the ability to explain highly technical information in a concise and effective manner to an audience of varying technical aptitude and to senior leaders of the Company.
* Sense of urgency to assess impact of security events, mobilize \\& influence resources from multiple departments and effectively communicate across leadership levels.
* Effective problem solving, with an emphasis on diagnosing and resolving root causes, and on building and supporting robust solutions.
* Data\\-driven approach to managing performance and driving continuous improvement.
* Ability to work independently, as a team member, and across the organization with colleagues at any level in a fast\\-paced environment.


**Technical Skills**
* Deep technical understanding of cloud computing (Azure, AWS), onPremise infrastructure \\& managed data center environments, networking, server administration, cybersecurity principles, and OT security principles, with experience in managing hybrid environments.
* Experience with OT specific standards and regulations like NERC CIP, with a focus on their application in the energy sector, and its dependencies to cyber security practices.
* Proven experience in designing and implementing secure hybrid architectures (cloud and onPremise) and managing cloud security tools and services.
* Experience managing cloud based and on\\-premise identity management systems.
* Experience managing technology infrastructure for remote monitoring and control systems, SCADA systems.
* Demonstrated experience implementing ITMS/ITIL processes and managing production environments (Change management, Incident management, problem management, etc.


 The expected starting pay range for this role is $187,000 \\- $254,000 USD. This range is an estimate and base pay may be above or below the ranges based on several factors including but not limited to location, work experience, certifications, and education. In addition to base pay, Pattern’s compensation program includes a bonus structure for full\\-time employees of all levels. We also provide a comprehensive benefits package which includes medical, dental, vision, short and long\\-term disability, life insurance, voluntary benefits, family care benefits, employee assistance program, paid time off and bonding leave, paid holidays, 401(k)/RRSP retirement savings plan with employer contribution, and employee referral bonuses.
   

  

**Pattern Energy Group is an Equal Opportunity Employer.**

title: IT System Administrator
description:
**Systems Administrator** 
  
 



**($65,000\\-$115,000\\)** 
  
 



 This position involves direct collaboration with customers and partners, offering expertise in hardware and software installations, troubleshooting, and providing configuration recommendations for complex systems and structures. Reporting to the CTO, this senior role requires a hands\\-on approach and the ability to balance the pressures of resolving advanced technical issues with clients and managing escalations within the internal  
 



 Opti\\-Vise IT team.  
 



 The primary mission of the
 **Systems Administrator** 
 is to maintain the network infrastructure of clients within the Opti\\-Vise IT portfolio. Responsibilities include installing, configuring, and troubleshooting network devices, implementing security measures, and ensuring reliable network connectivity for clients. 
 



 As a member of the
 **IT Services Team** 
 , the
 **Systems Administrator** 
 will work collaboratively with colleagues to address remote and onsite support escalations related to both managed hardware/services and general support issues. 
 



  





**Responsibilities:** 
  
 


* **Client Onboarding and Offboarding:**
* Assisting with the onboarding of new clients onto the MSP's network infrastructure, which involves network design, implementation, and migration of client systems. Similarly, when a client offboards from the MSP, the network administrator ensures a smooth transition of network resources and data.
* **Client Support and Service Requests:**
* Providing technical support to clients for network\\-related issues, including network connectivity, security, and performance problems. Responding to escalated service requests, incidents, and change requests in a timely manner and adhering to defined service level agreements (SLAs).
* **Network Monitoring and Management Tools:**
* Utilizing network monitoring and management tools provided by the MSP to proactively monitor client networks, track performance metrics, and identify potential issues. Generating reports, analyzing data, and taking appropriate actions to maintain network uptime and performance.
* **Security Services:**
* Implementing and managing network security services for clients, including firewall management, intrusion detection/prevention systems, virtual private networks (VPNs), and security incident response. Conducting regular security audits and assessments to identify vulnerabilities and recommend appropriate security measures.
* **Backup and Disaster Recovery:**
* Assisting clients in implementing network backup and disaster recovery solutions. This includes regular backups, testing of backup and recovery procedures, and ensuring data integrity and availability in case of network failures or disasters.



  
 



  
 


* **Documentation and Reporting:**
* Maintaining accurate documentation of client network configurations, changes, and procedures. Generating network performance reports, incident reports, and other documentation as required by the MSP and clients.
* **Vendor and Partner Coordination:**
* Collaborating with network equipment vendors, service providers, and technology partners to procure network hardware/software, resolve technical issues, and coordinate service delivery to clients.
* **Continuous Learning and Professional Development:**
* Keeping up to date with the latest networking technologies, industry trends, and certifications relevant to the MSP environment. Continuously improving technical skills and knowledge to provide the best network administration services to clients.



  
 



**Required Education:** 
  
 


* BS or MS Degree in Computer Science, Information Systems (or equivalent experience)
* Preferred Certifications: A\\+, Network\\+, Security\\+, AZ\\-900, AZ\\-104
* 



**Required Experience:** 
  
 


* 10 yrs\\+ experience as a Systems Administrator or Server Engineer (or relevant experience)
* Enterprise level Networking Experience / Advanced Switching \\& Routing troubleshooting – configuration and administration
* Microsoft Windows Server 2012 or later
* Microsoft Windows Server Roles: AD, DNS, DHCP, DFS, IIS, GPO
* Advanced PowerShell knowledge
* Advanced VoIP / SIP configuration and support
* Exchange 2013 or later
* Advanced Office 365 Administration
* Microsoft Azure, Entra ID, and Microsoft Endpoint Management Administration \\- Strong implementation \\& support knowledge
* Microsoft Intune or SCCM \\- Strong implementation \\& support knowledge
* Advanced Firewall Configuration (Fortinet and Sonicwall is a plus)
* Networking Experience
* Strong Performance analysis and troubleshooting skills
* Strong documentation skills
* Spam Filter technologies
* Hands on equipment experience (rack, and stack, physical wiring)
* Back\\-up Solutions
* 



**Technical Knowledge (not limited to):** 
  
 


* Microsoft Intune/Autopilot
* Fortinet Firewalls
* PSA Experience
* Azure/AVD Experience
* Printer/Fax/Scanner Troubleshooting
* Terminal Services, Microsoft failover clustering
* VMware (vSphere, View, vCenter)



  
 



**What You Can Expect From Us:** 
  
 


* A family\\-owned company that cares about you and your career growth.
* Professional development opportunities including certification path and reimbursement.
* Annual performance bonus in addition to base salary.
* A competitive benefits package including medical, dental, vision, 401(k) with company match, PTO, and paid holidays.

title: Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Construction
description:
**Journey with us!** 
 Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our incredible team of employees at
 **Royal Caribbean Group** 
 . We are proud to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.
   

  

 We are proud to be the vacation\\-industry leader with global brands — including Royal Caribbean International, Celebrity Cruises and Silversea Cruises — the most innovative fleet and private destinations, and the best people. Together, we are dedicated to turning the vacation of a lifetime into a lifetime of vacations for our guests.
   

  

 Royal Caribbean Group’s
 **IT \\- Shipboard Newbuild** 
 Team has an exciting career opportunity for a full time
 **Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Construction** 
 reporting to the
 **Senior Director, IT Program Newbuild** 
 .
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The
 **Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Construction** 
 manages the portfolio of IT shipboard construction projects, ensuring they are completed on time, within scope, and within budget. The role includes developing and implementing IT strategies and initiatives that align with the overall business objectives. Managing and leading a team of IT professionals, providing guidance, support, and mentorship. Collaboration with other key departments and stakeholders to ensure seamless integration and delivery of IT scope as part of the New Build Start Up Team. Monitoring and reporting on the performance of IT projects, identifying areas for improvement, and implementing corrective actions as needed are also part of the responsibilities. Ensuring compliance with IT policies, procedures, and standards, managing the allocation of resources, including personnel, budget, and equipment to optimize project delivery, and staying up\\-to\\-date with the latest industry trends and technologies are also crucial.
   

  

 With financial oversight of $50M\\-$100M in project budgets, this role ensures optimal resource allocation, cost efficiency, and adherence to financial and IT governance policies. The Senior Manager monitors project performance, identifies risks, and drives process improvements to enhance operational effectiveness. Additionally, they stay ahead of industry trends, ensuring IT infrastructure and solutions support Royal Caribbean’s evolving fleet and innovation goals.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Create collaborative partnership with the IT Shipboard Product Teams to influence and drive priority of New Technologies for New ships in construction.
* Manages the intake process of NB programs through the governance process, inclusive of IT projects and broader Royal Caribbean Group initiatives.
* Create a collaborative partnership among portfolio stakeholders that enables resource demand planning, budget management, initiative strategic alignment, change management, and project pipeline planning decisions.
* Works with IT Finance to support labor forecasting and reporting needs on projects and programs across the organization.
* Partners with other business departments (Marine, Logistics, Newbuild, Engineering, Architecture) to engage and onboard needed resources in order to implement scope.
* Oversees portfolio artifacts, decisions, communications, metrics, and reporting.
* Manages $50\\-120M annual budget across multiple NB projects including budget expenditures, spend analysis, variances and developing controls and metrics for ensuring on\\-budget performance KPIs.
* Supports Delivery Leads, Program and Project Managers within portfolio with delivery and reviews to confirm adherence to Delivery Team methodology.
* Develops and delivers program and project management training to improve consistency and quality in project delivery.
* Develop and deploy project and program auditing strategy with a focus on visibility into trends, communication to steering committees, risk mitigation.
* Support product integration within RCG Fleets with insight contributions from within, and across, portfolio activities.
* Build strong relationships within Royal Caribbean Group to understand the business challenges and opportunities.
* Manages Executive Portfolio views and reports, provide timely and actionable stakeholder updates in reduce roadblocks and risks.
* Support the development, innovation and adherence to the Royal Caribbean Group’s IT Delivery Team methodologies including the support \\& creation of project management best practices, tools, and ways for Royal Caribbean Group to drive efficiency in order to reduce costs and add value.


**Qualifications, Knowledge And Skills**
 Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT project management, with at least 5 years in a leadership role.
   

  

* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Able to present direct and concise information to Vice President and above roles.
* Experience working with hospitality systems preferred.
* Experience in executing heavy IT infrastructure projects in a construction environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* In\\-depth knowledge of IT project management methodologies and tools.
* Strong problem\\-solving and decision\\-making abilities.
* Ability to work effectively with cross\\-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Knowledge of industry trends and best practices in IT project management.
* PMP, PRINCE2, or other relevant project management certifications are preferred.


**We know there's a lot to consider.** 
 As you go through the application process, our recruiters will be glad to provide guidance, and more relevant details to answer any additional questions. Thank you again for your interest in Royal Caribbean Group. We'll hope to see you onboard soon!
   

  

 It is the policy of the Company to ensure equal employment and promotion opportunity to qualified candidates without discrimination or harassment on the basis of race, color, religion, sex, age, national origin, disability, sexual orientation, sexuality, gender identity or expression, marital status, or any other characteristic protected by law. Royal Caribbean Group and each of its subsidiaries prohibit and will not tolerate discrimination or harassment.

title: IT Program Manager - Air Force Maintenance Operations (REMIS) -  (REF1771Q)
description:
**Company Description**
 Citizant is a leading provider of professional IT services to the U.S. government. We seek to address some of our country’s most pressing challenges in the areas of Agile application development, Enterprise Data Management, Enterprise Architecture, Product Management, and Program Management support services. We strive to hire only ethical, talented, passionate and committed “A Players” who already align with the company’s core values: Drive, Delivering Excellence, Reputation, Responsibility, and a Better Future. No matter how large we grow, Citizant will retain its collaborative, supportive, small\\-company culture, where successful team effort to address external and internal customer challenges is valued above all else.
   

  

**Job Description**
**Salary Range:** 
 $125,000K to $140,000K (depending on experience)
   

  

**Position Overview:**
 We are seeking a highly experienced IT Project Manager with 10\\+ years of experience managing large\\-scale IT programs, leading teams of 30\\+ IT professionals, and overseeing Agile operations and development. The ideal candidate will hold a Project Management Professional (PMP) certification and a Certified Scrum Master (CSM) certification (preferred). The IT Project Manager will provide strategic leadership, effectively controlling costs, schedule, performance, and risk management. This role requires extensive experience in Agile methodologies, IT governance, and stakeholder collaboration to support Air Force operational and development activities.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities:**
* Implement Agile best practices, providing coaching and support to both Government and Contractor personnel to enhance team performance. Ensure Agile frameworks align with mission objectives and operational requirements.
* Develop and manage IT project plans, milestones, and deliverables, ensuring projects meet cost, schedule, and performance targets.
* Serve as the primary liaison between technical teams and business stakeholders, ensuring alignment of IT solutions with organizational goals. Provide briefings, reports, and key audit support to Government leadership.
* Establish quality assurance processes, evaluate and refine all phases of the development pipeline, conduct risk assessments, and implement mitigation strategies to ensure project success.
* Oversee a team of 30\\+ IT professionals, managing resources effectively to optimize Agile development and operations.
* Assist the Government with audit preparations, reporting, and compliance reviews related to IT program execution and security requirements.
* Implement controls to address potential classified data spills into the unclassified REMIS system. Maintain compliance with Air Force security protocols and data handling procedures.


 Qualifications
   

  

* 10\\+ years of IT project management experience, managing contracts with 30\\+ IT professionals.
* Extensive experience in Agile project management, IT governance, and risk management.
* Strong knowledge of IT systems, cybersecurity, and classified data management within Air Force or DoD environments.


**Education:**
* Bachelor’s degree in Information Technology, Computer Science, or a related field.
* PMP certification is required; CSM is preferred.


**Clearance Requirement:**
* Must be a US Citizen
* Active Secret Clearance is required


 Additional Information
   

  

 Citizant strives to be an employer of choice in the Washington metropolitan area. Citizant associates accept challenging and rewarding work and in return receive excellent compensation and benefits, as well as the opportunity for personal and professional development.
   

  

 Citizant is an Equal Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, sex, pregnancy, sexual orientation, gender identity, national origin, age, protected veteran status, or disability status.

 We are seeking a dynamic and experienced Chief Technology Officer to join our leadership team. As CTO, will be responsible for developing and implementing a technology strategy that aligns with our company’s strategic goals, driving innovation, and ensuring operational efficiency.

**Qualifications**

title: Senior IT Support Specialist
description:
**Title: Sr. IT Support Specialist
   

  

 Classification: Exempt**
**About The Organization**
 RoadSafe Traffic Systems is the largest national provider of traffic safety products and services in the United States. RoadSafe serves customers in all 48 contiguous states through its network of more than 60\\+ branch locations. At RoadSafe, we offer competitive pay, growth potential, and an excellent benefits package, including medical, dental, vision, and 401(k) plans for those who qualify. We recognize and value diversity and are committed to creating an inclusive environment for all employees.
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Senior IT Support Specialist is responsible for providing proactive and responsive support to RoadSafe computer users, ensuring optimal performance of computer systems, hardware, and software. This role includes troubleshooting enterprise applications, hardware, software, Office 365, license management, onboarding/offboarding, and other IT\\-related tasks. The specialist will handle inbound helpdesk queries, diagnose and resolve technical issues, and support Local Area Networks (LAN), Wide Area Networks (WAN), and other systems as needed.
   

  

**Key Responsibilities**
* Manage multiple employee/user requests while balancing priorities and deadlines.
* Collaborate with IT teams to ensure seamless integration of server and network systems with enterprise applications.
* Develop, implement, and adhere to IT policies and procedures, ensuring compliance with best practices and regulations.
* Provide technical support for computer systems, software, and hardware via in\\-person, phone, email, or ticketing systems.
* Serve as an escalation point for vendors and managed service providers.
* Maintain and optimize daily performance of computer systems.
* Guide employees/users through troubleshooting processes.
* Install, modify, and repair computer hardware and software (ability to lift/move equipment up to 50 lbs. required).
* Diagnose and resolve issues with LANs, WANs, and other systems.
* Monitor and maintain server hardware, software, and network infrastructure.
* Follow up with users to confirm issue resolution and run reports to identify recurring issues.
* Ability to sit for extended periods; some travel may be required.


**Technical Experience Required**
* Proficiency in Microsoft Office 365 and Microsoft Teams administration.
* Advanced understanding of Windows 11 and desktop computer hardware.
* Experience guiding end users through PC setup and troubleshooting.
* Expertise in data migration and profile transfers to new PC hardware.
* Experience with patch management systems and Azure.
* Mobile Device Management (MDM) experience (MaaS360 preferred but not required).
* Hands\\-on experience with Android and iOS mobile devices.
* Experience with helpdesk and documentation systems such as ConnectWise.
* Ability to troubleshoot software, hardware, printers, and networking remotely.


**Essential Skills And Qualifications**
* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Systems, or a related field preferred.
* 10\\+ years of experience in IT helpdesk, system administration, or network administration.
* In\\-depth knowledge of computer hardware, software, and networking systems.
* Experience with network communications, firewalls, and VPNs.
* Strong troubleshooting and problem\\-solving skills.
* Proficiency in common networking technologies and protocols.
* Microsoft Office 365 certifications or other relevant IT certifications are a plus.


**EOE Statement
   

  

 We are an Equal Employment Opportunity Employer. All qualified applicants will be considered without regard to race, color, religion, gender, national origin, disability, or veteran status.**

title: Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Design
description:
**Journey with us!** 
 Combine your career goals and sense of adventure by joining our incredible team of employees at
 **Royal Caribbean Group** 
 . We are proud to offer a competitive compensation and benefits package, and excellent career development opportunities, each offering unique ways to explore the world.
   

  

 We are proud to be the vacation\\-industry leader with global brands — including Royal Caribbean International, Celebrity Cruises and Silversea Cruises — the most innovative fleet and private destinations, and the best people. Together, we are dedicated to turning the vacation of a lifetime into a lifetime of vacations for our guests.
   

  

 Royal Caribbean Group’s IT \\- Shipboard Newbuild Team has an exciting career opportunity for a full time Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Design reporting to the Senior Director, IT Program Newbuild .
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The
 **Senior Manager, IT Newbuild Design** 
 is responsible for leading the IT design and integration for Royal Caribbean Group’s new ship classes. This role ensures that IT components align with business objectives, adhere to governance processes, and are seamlessly integrated across shipboard operations, infrastructure, cybersecurity, and external partners. The position requires collaboration with internal IT teams, marine and engineering stakeholders, and shipyard partners to define capability requirements and oversee the IT portfolio for new builds.
   

  

 This role also manages project planning, financial oversight, and resource allocation, ensuring that initiatives stay on budget ($6M\\-$10M annually) and deliver strategic value. The Senior Manager supports executive decision\\-making by providing portfolio reporting, identifying risks, and driving process improvements that enhance efficiency and cost\\-effectiveness. By fostering cross\\-functional partnerships and leveraging industry best practices, this position plays a key role in shaping the future of IT within Royal Caribbean Group’s fleet expansion and innovation efforts.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities**
* Supports the intake process of projects through the governance process, inclusive of IT projects and broader Royal Caribbean Group initiatives related to New Build.
* Lead the capability requirements definition across the various IT stakeholders (Infrastructure \\& Operations, Shipboard, Cyber Security) for each ship’s business model and integration requirements with product owners for architecture and build out.
* Lead design and integration activities between IT and RCG’s internal and external partners.
* Create a collaborative partnership among portfolio stakeholders that enables initiative strategic alignment and project pipeline planning decisions.
* Lead and manage the partnership with New Build Design and Architecture and the Product Development Innovation, Marine / NB Sustainability and local New Build Shipyard offices.
* Partners with other business departments (Marine, Logistics, Newbuild, Engineering, Architecture) to engage and onboard needed resources in order to design the scope and provide the guidelines for implementation.
* Manages portfolio artifacts, decisions, communications, metrics, and reporting.
* Manages $6\\-10M annual budget across multiple projects including budget expenditures, spend analysis, variances and developing controls and metrics for ensuring on\\-budget performance KPIs for the program design phase.
* Support product integration within RCG sites and asset with insight contributions from within, and across, portfolio activities.
* Build strong relationships within Royal Caribbean Group to understand the business challenges and opportunities.
* Manages Executive Portfolio views and reports, provide timely and actionable stakeholder updates in reduce roadblocks and risks for the NB Design stage
* Support the development, innovation and adherence to the Royal Caribbean Group’s IT Delivery Team methodologies including the support \\& creation of project management best practices, tools, and ways for Royal Caribbean Group to drive efficiency in order to reduce costs and add value.
* Works closely with Product teams, Site Architects and Construction partners to develop design for the New Builds and execution strategies related to the project scope.


**Qualifications, Knowledge And Skills**
 Minimum of 10 years of experience in IT project management, IT solution design and integration of IT design with Architecture or IT operations, with at least 5 years in a leadership role. Experience in the IT Solution design in the cruise industry preferred.
   

  

* Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Information Technology, or a related field. A Master's degree is preferred.
* Strong leadership and team management skills.
* Able to present direct and concise information to Vice President and above roles.
* Experience working with hospitality systems preferred.
* Experience in the IT design engagement and working with architects in construction projects
* Experience in executing IT infrastructure projects in a construction environment.
* Excellent communication and interpersonal skills.
* Proven ability to manage multiple projects simultaneously.
* In\\-depth knowledge of IT project management methodologies and tools.
* Strong problem\\-solving and decision\\-making abilities.
* Ability to work effectively with cross\\-functional teams and stakeholders.
* Knowledge of industry trends and best practices in IT project management.
* Demonstrates a wide degree of creativity with strong analytical and problem\\-solving skills
* Must have ability to adapt to shifting priorities and align activities to meet organizational goals
* Drives value engineering processes in partnership with the NB site office teams to drive cost down.
* PMP, PRINCE2, or other relevant project management certifications are preferred.

title: Chief Information Officer
description:
**Position Description**
**Position Title:** 
 Chief Information Officer (CIO)
   

  

**Position Summary**
 The Chief Information Officer (CIO) serves as a key executive leader responsible for overseeing the company’s information technology/services (IT/IS) and digital transformation initiatives. The CIO provides strategic vision, leadership, and execution in IT infrastructure, cybersecurity, compliance, and innovation to ensure operational excellence, scalability, and alignment with business objectives. This role provides direction to the staff and/or contract support resources in the Information Services Department (ISD) in the performance of the duties/scope, priorities and goal achievement in accordance with Zeiders’ corporate policies and management philosophy. The CIO ensures the security, reliability, and efficiency of the organization's IS landscape while driving future\\-focused technology adoption and regulatory compliance.
   

  

**Essential Duties And Responsibilities** 
  

  

* Strategic Leadership
+ Develop and implement an IT strategy aligned with corporate goals and business requirements.
+ Advise the CEO and executive team on emerging technology trends, risks, and opportunities.
+ Lead digital transformation initiatives to enhance operational efficiency and customer experience.
+ Define IT governance frameworks, technology roadmaps, and data management strategies.

* Technology Operations \\& Innovation
+ Oversee IT infrastructure, software applications, cloud solutions, and enterprise systems.
+ Ensure the reliability, scalability, and performance of technology services worldwide.
+ Direct the development and deployment of company technology systems such as ERP, CRM, SaaS solutions, and analytics platforms.
+ Evaluate new technologies to optimize business operations and enhance service delivery.

* Cybersecurity \\& Compliance
+ Establish and enforce robust cybersecurity policies and protocols to protect corporate and client data.
+ Ensure compliance with federal regulations, including DFARS, CMMC, NIST 800\\-171, and FedRAMP.
+ Conduct ongoing risk assessments, audits, and security training programs.
+ Support contract delivery and ensure technology services are compliant with contractual requirements and company policies

* ISD Governance \\& Resource Management


* 
+ Develop and manage the IT budget, ensuring cost\\-effective allocation of resources.
+ Establish a balanced mix of in\\-house and outsourced IT services to optimize efficiency and scalability.
+ Oversee IT vendor relationships, contract negotiations, and service level agreements.
+ Monitor and report on the ROI of technology investments and initiatives


  

  

* Team Leadership \\& Development
* 
+ Lead, mentor, and develop a high\\-performing Information Services Department team to drive excellence in execution.
+ Foster a culture of collaboration, innovation, accountability, and continuous improvement. Live the company’s Core Values.
+ Oversee technical training and development programs to build capabilities and ensure knowledge retention.
+ Drive talent development, succession planning, and career growth opportunities within the IT department.

* Stakeholder Engagement \\& Business Development
* 
+ 
- Act as a strategic partner across business units to align IT initiatives with corporate objectives.
- Engage with federal agencies, partners, and clients to support business development and contract fulfillment.
- Represent the company at industry forums, conferences, and technology advisory boards.
- Ensures technical and cyber security specification reviews of all bids and proposals in conjunction with business development activities.


**Education Or Experience Required Qualifications**
* Bachelor’s degree in computer science, Information Systems, or a related field.
* At least one DoD 8140 Advance certification; CCISO, CISM, GSLC, CISSP/ISSEP/ISSMP.
* Minimum of 10 years of progressive IT leadership experience, with at least 5 years in a CIO or equivalent role.
* At least 3 years’ experience in Government Contracting industry.
* Deep expertise in IT strategy, enterprise architecture, cloud computing, and cybersecurity.
* Strong knowledge of federal compliance frameworks, including DFARS, NIST 800\\-171, and CMMC.
* Proven track record of leading large\\-scale digital transformation initiatives.
* Knowledge in the support of call center functions.
* Knowledge of data center operations, performance and data center vendors.
* Experience managing IT in a global, multi\\-site environment.
* Extensive use of support desk applications such as a ticket tracking system, systems management tools, systems monitoring tools and operational intelligence tools.
* Strong financial acumen with experience in IT budget planning and cost optimization.
* Exceptional communication, negotiation, and stakeholder management skills.
* Expertise in risk management and compliance


**Preferred Qualifications**
* Master’s degree preferred


**Competencies**
 To perform the job successfully, an individual should demonstrate the following competencies :
   

  

* Ability to work both independently and as part of a team.
* Problem Solving \\- Identifies and resolves problems in a timely manner; Gathers and analyzes information skillfully; Develops alternative solutions; Works well in group problem solving situations; Uses reason even when dealing with emotional topics.
* Customer Service \\- Manages difficult or emotional customer situations; Responds promptly to customer needs; Solicits customer feedback to improve service ; Responds to requests for service and assistance; Meets commitments.
* Interpersonal Skills \\- Focuses on solving conflict, not blaming; Maintains confidentiality; Listens to others without interrupting; Keeps emotions under control; Remains open to others' ideas and tries new things.
* Oral Communication \\- Speaks clearly and persuasively in positive or negative situations; Listens and gets clarification; Responds well to questions; Demonstrates group presentation skills; Participates in meetings.
* Written Communication \\- Writes clearly and informatively; Edits work for spelling and grammar; Varies writing style to meet needs; Presents numerical data effectively; Able to read and interpret written information.
* Teamwork \\- Balances team and individual responsibilities; Exhibits objectivity and openness to others' views; Gives and welcomes feedback; Contributes to building a positive team spirit; Puts success of team above own interests; Able to build morale and group commitments to goals and objectives; Supports everyone's efforts to succeed.
* Change Management \\- Develops workable implementation plans; Communicates changes effectively; Builds commitment and overcomes resistance; Prepares and supports those affected by change; Monitors transition and evaluates results.
* Leadership \\- Exhibits confidence in self and others; Inspires and motivates others to perform well; effectively influences actions and opinions of others; Accepts feedback from others; Gives appropriate recognition to others.
* Managing People \\- Includes staff in planning, decision\\-making, facilitating and process improvement; Takes responsibility for subordinates' activities; Makes self available to staff; Provides regular performance feedback; Develops subordinates' skills and encourages growth; Solicits and applies customer feedback (internal and external); Fosters quality focus in others; Improves processes, products and services.; Continually works to improve supervisory skills.
* Quality Management \\- Looks for ways to improve and promote quality; Demonstrates accuracy and thoroughness.
* Project Management \\- Develops project plans; Coordinates projects. Communicates changes and progress. Completes projects on time and on budget. Manages project team activities.


**Physical Demands**
* Works in office areas. Sits, stands, bends, lifts, and moves intermittently during working hours.
* Uses computer, telephones, copiers, printers and other office equipment. The employee must occasionally lift and/or move up to 10 pounds.


 The physical demands described here are representative of those that must be met by an employee to successfully perform the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   

  

**Work Environment:** 
 The work environment characteristics described here are representative of those an employee encounters while performing the essential functions of this job. Reasonable accommodations may be made to enable individuals with disabilities to perform the essential functions.
   

  

 The noise level in the work environment is usually quiet.
   

  

**Travel**
* Infrequent travel as necessary to achieve corporate objectives.


***Zeiders Enterprises, Inc. is an Equal Opportunity Employer.***

title: Systems Administrator
description:
**Description**
 Evolus is a performance beauty company with a customer\\-centric approach focused on delivering breakthrough products. We are seeking an experienced, collaborative Systems Administrator. This individual will be part of a small, highly motivated IT team, responsible for engineering, managing, and supporting corporate IT systems \\& infrastructure for our growing company. This role will be the subject matter expert for critical IT systems keeping our business operations running efficiently. This is a great opportunity for someone who enjoys a fast\\-paced, ever\\-changing environment, new challenges, evolving their skills and improving processes. If you are looking for an opportunity to showcase your abilities while growing your knowledge, then look no further! In this role, you will be challenged to drive the success of Evolus to build a brand like no other.
   

  

**Let’s talk about some of the key responsibilities of the role:**
* Provide technical ownership of corporate and IT systems (e.g., Jira, Confluence, Azure AD, SharePoint Online, Teams, Exchange Online, M365, and other cloud systems and infrastructure)
* Research, engineer, and implement new or enhance existing technology
* Support SOX ITGC controls and processes relating, but not limited to authentication, provisioning, user access review, change management, and change monitoring.
* Maintain comprehensive documentation of system configuration, processes, and procedures
* Integrate new applications into existing network infrastructure following architectural and established technical standards
* Recommend and develop technical standards for responsible systems
* Conduct root\\-cause analysis for network or system outages and develop remediation plans
* Conduct capacity planning of network and systems resources to ensure optimal availability and performance of IT infrastructure
* Develop knowledge base articles and standard operating procedures
* Provide escalated end\\-user support for business users
* Serve as Tier 3 escalation resource for IT Operations team
* Other duties as assigned


**Skills and Qualifications Required for this Dynamic Team Member:**
* Bachelor’s degree with coursework in Computer Science, CIS, MIS or related field trade certificates comparable to degree/experience
* 3\\+ years of hands\\-on experience in systems engineering or administration
* Microsoft Azure and Amazon AWS certifications is highly preferred
* Advance knowledge and experience with M365 and cloud infrastructure (e.g., Azure, AWS, GCP, etc.)
* Proficient in PowerShell scripting, automated deployments, and mass imaging
* Excellent verbal \\& written communication skills and ability to effectively communicate with audience members at all levels within the organization
* Strong analytical problem\\-solving skills
* Ability to quickly grasp technical issues and offer solutions
* Positive, can\\-do attitude with strong desire to solve problems
* Attention to detail while working in a fast\\-paced environment


**A Few Other Items Worth Mentioning:**
* Office location – Newport Beach, CA (hybrid onsite Tuesday, Wednesday and Thursday)
* This position reports directly to the Manager, IT Operations


**Compensation \\& Total Rewards**
 The expected pay range for this position is $83,600 to $104,500\\. Your actual base salary will be determined on a case\\-by\\-case basis and may vary based on a number of considerations including but not limited to role relevant knowledge and skills, experience, education, certifications, and more.
   

  

 We offer more than just a paycheck, and your base salary is just the start! Stay happy and healthy with our competitive suite of medical, dental and vision benefits to help you feel your best and be your best. We also provide those benefits you shouldn’t have to worry about, from employer covered life insurance to short\\-term disability. Take advantage of the 401k match offered by Evolus and let us invest in your future. You may also be eligible for new hire equity and long\\-term incentives in the form of RSUs, stock options, and/or discretionary bonuses. We offer mental health and wellbeing resources for you to develop skills to find your calm, boost your confidence, and show up as your best self in work and life. Travel or relax and come back feeling refreshed with our flexible paid time off program for exempt employees and a paid time off accrual plan for non\\-exempt employees. Did we mention the holiday soft closure between the Christmas and New Years holidays? We have that, too. Additional perks include regularly catered team meals at our Evolus Headquarters, a fully stocked kitchen (Kombucha \\& Coffee included), and the opportunity to join an organization where our values of Grit, Impact, Fun, and Transparency are displayed daily.
   

  

 Evolus takes pride in being a company on the forefront of innovation, while being committed to conducting its business with the highest degrees of integrity, professionalism, and social responsibility. We are also committed to complying with all laws and regulations that apply to our business. Employee welfare is no different. Here at Evolus, we don’t just work together, we’ve built a culture of inclusion! Because of this, you’ll find yourself immersed in an environment that not only promotes respect, collaboration and team building, but a community too. And that’s just the tip of the iceberg. Join our team and see for yourself! EOE M/F/D/V. For more information, please visit our website at www.evolus.com.
